components.name: accordion
components.title: Angular Accordion Component
components.description: Accordion groups a collection of contents in tabs.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Accordion header elements have a button role and use aria-controls to define the id of the content section along with aria-expanded for the visibility state. The value to read a header element defaults to the value of the header property and can be customized by defining an aria-label or aria-labelledby property. Each header has a heading role, for which the level is customized by headerAriaLevel and has a default level of 2 as per W3C specifications. Disabled accordions headers use aria-disabled and are excluded from the keybord navigation. The content uses region role, defines an id that matches the aria-controls of the header and aria-labelledby referring to the id of the header. Header Keyboard Support

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Accordion is defined using AccordionPanel , AccordionHeader and AccordionContent components. Each AccordionPanel must contain a unique value property to specify the active item.

sections.label: Multiple
sections.description: Only one tab at a time can be active by default, enabling multiple property changes this behavior to allow multiple tabs. In this case activeIndex needs to be an array.

props.name: value
props.description: Value of the active tab.

props.name: multiple
props.description: When enabled, multiple tabs can be activated at the same time.

props.name: styleClass
props.description: Class of the element.

props.name: expandIcon
props.description: Icon of a collapsed tab.

props.name: collapseIcon
props.description: Icon of an expanded tab.

props.name: selectOnFocus
props.description: When enabled, the focused tab is activated.

props.name: transitionOptions
props.description: Transition options of the animation.

props.name: motionOptions
props.description: The motion options.

props.name: dt
props.description: Defines scoped design tokens of the component.

props.name: unstyled
props.description: Indicates whether the component should be rendered without styles.

props.name: pt
props.description: Used to pass attributes to DOM elements inside the component.

props.name: ptOptions
props.description: Used to configure passthrough(pt) options of the component.

emits.name: onClose
emits.description: Callback to invoke when an active tab is collapsed by clicking on the header.

emits.name: onOpen
emits.description: Callback to invoke when a tab gets expanded.

pt.name: root
pt.description: Used to pass attributes to the root's DOM element.

pt.name: motion
pt.description: Used to pass options to the motion component/directive.

styles.description: Class name of the root element
Class name of the content wrapper

components.name: autocomplete
components.title: Angular AutoComplete Component
components.description: AutoComplete is an input component that provides real-time suggestions when being typed.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Value to describe the component can either be provided via label tag combined with inputId prop or using ariaLabelledBy , ariaLabel props. The input element has combobox role in addition to aria-autocomplete , aria-haspopup and aria-expanded attributes. The relation between the input and the popup is created with aria-controls and aria-activedescendant attribute is used to instruct screen reader which option to read during keyboard navigation within the popup list. In multiple mode, chip list uses listbox role whereas each chip has the option role with aria-label set to the label of the chip. The popup list has an id that refers to the aria-controls attribute of the input element and uses listbox as the role. Each list item has option role and an id to match the aria-activedescendant of the input element.

examples.basic: Email

sections.label: advanced-chips-doc
sections.description: This example demonstrates an advanced use case with templating, object handling, dropdown, and multiple mode.

examples.basic:
{{ product.name }} {{ product.category }}
\${{ product.price }}
@if (value.price) {
{{ value.name }} \${{ value.price }}
} @else { {{ value }} }
examples.html:
{{ product.name }} {{ product.category }}
\${{ product.price }}
@if (value.price) {
{{ value.name }} \${{ value.price }}
} @else { {{ value }} }

sections.label: basic-chips-doc
sections.description: With multiple enabled, the AutoComplete component behaves like a chips or tags input. Use addOnBlur , addOnTab , and separator properties to customize the keystroke behavior for adding items.

examples.basic:
<label for="chips-blur" class="font-bold mb-2 block">With Add On Blur</label>
<p-autocomplete [(ngModel)]="valueBlur" inputId="chips-blur" multiple fluid [typeahead]="false" [addOnBlur]="true" placeholder="Type and click outside to add..." />
<label for="chips-tab" class="font-bold mt-8 mb-2 block">With Add On Tab</label>
<p-autocomplete [(ngModel)]="valueTab" inputId="chips-tab" multiple fluid [typeahead]="false" [addOnTab]="true" placeholder="Type and press Tab to add..." />
<label for="chips-separator" class="font-bold mt-8 mb-2 block">With Separator (Comma)</label>
<p-autocomplete [(ngModel)]="valueSeparator" inputId="chips-separator" multiple fluid [typeahead]="false" separator="," placeholder="Type items separated by comma..." />
<label for="chips-combined" class="font-bold mt-8 mb-2 block">Combined Features</label>
<p-autocomplete [(ngModel)]="valueCombined" inputId="chips-combined" multiple fluid [typeahead]="false" [addOnBlur]="true" [addOnTab]="true" separator="," placeholder="Use Tab, Blur, or Comma to add items..." />

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: AutoComplete uses ngModel for two-way binding, requires a list of suggestions and a completeMethod to query for the results. The completeMethod gets the query text as event.query property and should update the suggestions with the search results.

examples.basic: <p-autocomplete [(ngModel)]="value" [suggestions]="items" (completeMethod)="search($event)" />

sections.label: clear-icon-doc
sections.description: When showClear is enabled, a clear icon is displayed to clear the value.

examples.basic: <p-autocomplete [(ngModel)]="value" [suggestions]="items" (completeMethod)="search($event)" [showClear]="true" inputStyleClass="w-56" />

sections.label: Disabled
sections.description: When disabled is present, the element cannot be edited and focused.

examples.basic: <p-autocomplete [(ngModel)]="selectedItem" [suggestions]="suggestions" placeholder="Disabled" (completeMethod)="search($event)" [disabled]="true" />

sections.label: Dropdown
sections.description: Enabling dropdown property displays a button next to the input field where click behavior of the button is defined using dropdownMode property that takes blank or current as possible values. blank is the default mode to send a query with an empty string whereas current setting sends a query with the current value of the input.

examples.basic: <p-autocomplete [(ngModel)]="value" [dropdown]="true" [suggestions]="items" (completeMethod)="search($event)" />

sections.label: Filled
sections.description: Specify the variant property as filled to display the component with a higher visual emphasis than the default outlined style.

examples.basic: <p-autocomplete [(ngModel)]="selectedItem" [suggestions]="suggestions" (completeMethod)="search($event)" variant="filled" />

sections.label: float-label-doc
sections.description: A floating label appears on top of the input field when focused. Visit FloatLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<p-floatlabel>
    <p-autocomplete [(ngModel)]="value1" [suggestions]="items" (completeMethod)="search($event)" inputId="over_label" />
    <label for="over_label">Over Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>
<p-floatlabel variant="in">
    <p-autocomplete [(ngModel)]="value2" [suggestions]="items" (completeMethod)="search($event)" inputId="in_label" />
    <label for="in_label">In Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>
<p-floatlabel variant="on">
    <p-autocomplete [(ngModel)]="value3" [suggestions]="items" (completeMethod)="search($event)" inputId="on_label" />
    <label for="on_label">On Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>

sections.label: Fluid
sections.description: The fluid prop makes the component take up the full width of its container when set to true.

examples.basic: <p-autocomplete [(ngModel)]="value" [suggestions]="items" (completeMethod)="search($event)" fluid />

sections.label: force-selection-doc
sections.description: ForceSelection mode validates the manual input to check whether it also exists in the suggestions list, if not the input value is cleared to make sure the value passed to the model is always one of the suggestions.

examples.basic: <p-autocomplete [(ngModel)]="selectedCountry" [forceSelection]="true" [suggestions]="filteredCountries" (completeMethod)="filterCountry($event)" optionLabel="name" />

sections.label: Group
sections.description: Option grouping is enabled when group property is set to true . group template is available to customize the option groups. All templates get the option instance as the default local template variable.

examples.basic: {{ group.label }}
examples.html: {{ group.label }}

sections.label: ifta-label-doc
sections.description: IftaLabel is used to create infield top aligned labels. Visit IftaLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<p-iftalabel>
    <p-autocomplete [(ngModel)]="value" [suggestions]="items" (completeMethod)="search($event)" inputId="ac" />
    <label for="ac">Identifier</label>
</p-iftalabel>

sections.label: Invalid
sections.description: The invalid state is applied using the invalid property to indicate failed validation, which can be integrated with Angular Forms.

examples.basic:
<p-autocomplete [(ngModel)]="value1" [suggestions]="suggestions" [invalid]="!value1" (completeMethod)="search($event)" placeholder="Code" />
<p-autocomplete [(ngModel)]="value2" [suggestions]="suggestions" [invalid]="!value2" (completeMethod)="search($event)" variant="filled" placeholder="Code" />

sections.label: Multiple
sections.description: Enable multiple selection mode using the multiple property to allow users to select more than one value from the autocomplete. When enabled, the value reference must be an array.

examples.basic:
<label for="multiple-ac-1" class="font-bold mb-2 block">With Typeahead</label>
<p-autocomplete [(ngModel)]="value1" inputId="multiple-ac-1" multiple fluid [suggestions]="items" (completeMethod)="search($event)" />
<label for="multiple-ac-2" class="font-bold mt-8 mb-2 block">Without Typeahead</label>
<p-autocomplete [(ngModel)]="value2" inputId="multiple-ac-2" multiple fluid (completeMethod)="search($event)" [typeahead]="false" />

sections.label: Objects
sections.description: AutoComplete can also work with objects using the optionLabel property that defines the label to display as a suggestion. The value passed to the model would still be the object instance of a suggestion. Here is an example with a Country object that has name and code fields such as {name: "United States", code:"USA"} .

examples.basic: <p-autocomplete [(ngModel)]="selectedCountry" [suggestions]="filteredCountries" (completeMethod)="filterCountry($event)" optionLabel="name" />

sections.label: reactive-forms-doc
sections.description: AutoComplete can also be used with reactive forms. In this case, the formControlName property is used to bind the component to a form control.

examples.basic: @if (isInvalid('value')) { Value is required. }
examples.html: @if (isInvalid('value')) { Value is required. }

sections.label: Sizes
sections.description: AutoComplete provides small and large sizes as alternatives to the base.

examples.basic:
<p-autocomplete [(ngModel)]="value1" [suggestions]="items" (completeMethod)="search()" size="small" placeholder="Small" dropdown />
<p-autocomplete [(ngModel)]="value2" [suggestions]="items" (completeMethod)="search()" placeholder="Normal" dropdown />
<p-autocomplete [(ngModel)]="value3" [suggestions]="items" (completeMethod)="search()" size="large" placeholder="Large" dropdown />

sections.label: Template
sections.description: AutoComplete offers multiple templates for customization through templating.

examples.basic:
{{ country.name }}
Available Countries
examples.html:
{{ country.name }}
Available Countries

examples.basic: @if (val.invalid && (val.touched || exampleForm.submitted)) { Value is required. }
examples.html: @if (val.invalid && (val.touched || exampleForm.submitted)) { Value is required. }

sections.label: virtual-scroll-doc
sections.description: Virtual scrolling is an efficient way of rendering the options by displaying a small subset of data in the viewport at any time. When dealing with huge number of options, it is suggested to enable virtual scrolling to avoid performance issues. Usage is simple as setting virtualScroll property to true and defining virtualScrollItemSize to specify the height of an item.

examples.basic: <p-autocomplete [(ngModel)]="selectedItem" [virtualScroll]="true" [suggestions]="filteredItems" [virtualScrollItemSize]="34" (completeMethod)="filterItems($event)" optionLabel="label" [dropdown]="true" />

props.name: virtualScrollItemSize
props.description: Height of an item in the list for VirtualScrolling.

props.description: Whether to use the scroller feature. The properties of scroller component can be used like an object in it.

props.name: forceSelection
props.description: When present, autocomplete clears the manual input if it does not match of the suggestions to force only accepting values from the suggestions.

props.name: type
props.description: Type of the input, defaults to "text".

props.name: autoZIndex
props.description: Whether to automatically manage layering.

props.description: Defines a string that labels the input for accessibility.

props.name: dropdownAriaLabel
props.description: Defines a string that labels the dropdown button for accessibility.

props.name: ariaLabelledBy
props.description: Specifies one or more IDs in the DOM that labels the input field.

props.name: dropdownIcon
props.description: Icon class of the dropdown icon.

props.name: unique
props.description: Ensures uniqueness of selected items on multiple mode.

props.name: group
props.description: Whether to display options as grouped when nested options are provided.

props.name: completeOnFocus
props.description: Whether to run a query when input receives focus.

props.name: showClear
props.description: When enabled, a clear icon is displayed to clear the value.

props.name: dropdown
props.description: Displays a button next to the input field when enabled.

props.name: showEmptyMessage
props.description: Whether to show the empty message or not.

props.name: dropdownMode
props.description: Specifies the behavior dropdown button. Default "blank" mode sends an empty string and "current" mode sends the input value.

props.name: multiple
props.description: Specifies if multiple values can be selected.

props.name: addOnTab
props.description: When enabled, the input value is added to the selected items on tab key press when multiple is true and typeahead is false.

props.name: tabindex
props.description: Index of the element in tabbing order.

props.name: dataKey
props.description: A property to uniquely identify a value in options.

props.name: emptyMessage
props.description: Text to display when there is no data. Defaults to global value in i18n translation configuration.

props.name: showTransitionOptions
props.description: Transition options of the show animation.

props.name: hideTransitionOptions
props.description: Transition options of the hide animation.

props.name: autofocus
props.description: When present, it specifies that the component should automatically get focus on load.

props.name: autocomplete
props.description: Used to define a string that autocomplete attribute the current element.

props.name: optionGroupChildren
props.description: Name of the options field of an option group.

props.name: optionGroupLabel
props.description: Name of the label field of an option group.

props.name: overlayOptions
props.description: Options for the overlay element.

props.name: suggestions
props.description: An array of suggestions to display.

props.name: optionLabel
props.description: Property name or getter function to use as the label of an option.

props.name: optionValue
props.description: Property name or getter function to use as the value of an option.

props.name: id
props.description: Unique identifier of the component.

props.name: searchMessage
props.description: Text to display when the search is active. Defaults to global value in i18n translation configuration.

props.name: emptySelectionMessage
props.description: Text to display when filtering does not return any results. Defaults to global value in i18n translation configuration.

props.name: selectionMessage
props.description: Text to be displayed in hidden accessible field when options are selected. Defaults to global value in i18n translation configuration.

props.name: autoOptionFocus
props.description: Whether to focus on the first visible or selected element when the overlay panel is shown.

props.name: selectOnFocus
props.description: When enabled, the focused option is selected.

props.name: searchLocale
props.description: Locale to use in searching. The default locale is the host environment's current locale.

props.name: optionDisabled
props.description: Property name or getter function to use as the disabled flag of an option, defaults to false when not defined.

props.name: focusOnHover
props.description: When enabled, the hovered option will be focused.

props.name: typeahead
props.description: Whether typeahead is active or not.

props.name: addOnBlur
props.description: Whether to add an item on blur event if the input has value and typeahead is false with multiple mode.

props.name: separator
props.description: Separator char to add item when typeahead is false and multiple mode is enabled.

props.name: appendTo
props.description: Target element to attach the overlay, valid values are "body" or a local ng-template variable of another element (note: use binding with brackets for template variables, e.g. [appendTo]="mydiv" for a div element having #mydiv as variable name).

props.name: motionOptions
props.description: The motion options.

props.name: dt
props.description: Defines scoped design tokens of the component.

props.name: unstyled
props.description: Indicates whether the component should be rendered without styles.

props.name: pt
props.description: Used to pass attributes to DOM elements inside the component.

props.name: ptOptions
props.description: Used to configure passthrough(pt) options of the component.

props.name: required
props.description: There must be a value (if set).

props.name: invalid
props.description: When present, it specifies that the component should have invalid state style.

props.name: disabled
props.description: When present, it specifies that the component should have disabled state style.

props.name: name
props.description: When present, it specifies that the name of the input.

props.name: fluid
props.description: Spans 100% width of the container when enabled.

props.name: variant
props.description: Specifies the input variant of the component.

props.name: size
props.description: Specifies the size of the component.

props.name: inputSize
props.description: Specifies the visible width of the input element in characters.

props.name: pattern
props.description: Specifies the value must match the pattern.

props.name: min
props.description: The value must be greater than or equal to the value.

props.name: max
props.description: The value must be less than or equal to the value.

props.name: step
props.description: Unless the step is set to the any literal, the value must be min + an integral multiple of the step.

props.name: minlength
props.description: The number of characters (code points) must not be less than the value of the attribute, if non-empty.

props.name: maxlength
props.description: The number of characters (code points) must not exceed the value of the attribute.

emits.description: Callback to invoke when a suggestion is selected.

emits.name: onHide

emits.name: onLazyLoad

components.name: autofocus
components.title: Angular AutoFocus Directive
components.description: AutoFocus manages focus on focusable element on load.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: AutoFocus is applied to any focusable input element with the pAutoFocus directive.

examples.basic: <input type="text" pInputText [pAutoFocus]="true" placeholder="Automatically focused" />

props.name: autofocus

components.name: avatar
components.title: Angular Avatar Component
components.description: Avatar represents people using icons, labels and images.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Avatar does not include any roles and attributes by default. Any attribute is passed to the root element so you may add a role like img along with aria-labelledby or aria-label to describe the component. In case avatars need to be tabbable, tabIndex can be added as well to implement custom key handlers. Keyboard Support Component does not include any interactive elements.

sections.label: AvatarGroup
sections.description: Grouping is available by wrapping multiple Avatar components inside an AvatarGroup .

examples.basic:
<p-avatar-group>
    <p-avatar image="https://primefaces.org/cdn/primeng/images/demo/avatar/amyelsner.png" size="large" shape="circle" />
    <p-avatar image="https://primefaces.org/cdn/primeng/images/demo/avatar/asiyajavayant.png" size="large" shape="circle" />
    <p-avatar image="https://primefaces.org/cdn/primeng/images/demo/avatar/onyamalimba.png" size="large" shape="circle" />
    <p-avatar image="https://primefaces.org/cdn/primeng/images/demo/avatar/ionibowcher.png" size="large" shape="circle" />
    <p-avatar image="https://primefaces.org/cdn/primeng/images/demo/avatar/xuxuefeng.png" size="large" shape="circle" />
    <p-avatar label="+2" shape="circle" size="large" />
</p-avatar-group>

components.name: badge
components.title: Angular Badge Component
components.description: Badge is a small status indicator for another element.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Badge does not include any roles and attributes by default, any attribute is passed to the root element so aria roles and attributes can be added if required. If the badges are dynamic, aria-live may be utilized as well. In case badges need to be tabbable, tabIndex can be added to implement custom key handlers. Keyboard Support Component does not include any interactive elements.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Content of the badge is specified using the value property.

examples.basic: <p-badge value="2" />

sections.label: Button
sections.description: Buttons have built-in support for badges to display a badge inline.

examples.basic:
<p-button label="Emails" icon="pi pi-bell" label="Notifications" badge="2" />
<p-button label="Inbox" icon="pi pi-inbox" badge="2" badgeSeverity="contrast" outlined />

sections.label: directive-doc
sections.description: Content of the badge is specified using the value property.

sections.label: Overlay
sections.description: A badge can be added to any element by encapsulating the content with the OverlayBadge component.

sections.label: position-doc
sections.description: A Badge can be positioned at the top right corner of an element by adding p-overlay-badge style class to the element and embedding the badge inside.

sections.label: Severity
sections.description: Severity defines the color of the badge, possible values are success , info , warn and danger

examples.basic:
<p-badge value="2" />
<p-badge value="6" severity="secondary" />
<p-badge value="8" severity="success" />
<p-badge value="4" severity="info" />
<p-badge value="9" severity="warn" />
<p-badge value="3" severity="danger" />
<p-badge value="5" severity="contrast" />

sections.label: Size
sections.description: Badge sizes are adjusted with the badgeSize property that accepts small , large and xlarge as the possible alternatives to the default size. Currently sizes only apply to component mode.

examples.basic:
<p-badge value="8" badgeSize="xlarge" severity="success" />
<p-badge value="6" badgeSize="large" severity="warn" />
<p-badge value="4" severity="info" />
<p-badge value="2" badgeSize="small" />

components.name: blockui
components.title: Angular BlockUI Component
components.description: BlockUI can either block other components or the whole page.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader BlockUI manages aria-busy state attribute when the UI gets blocked and unblocked. Any valid attribute is passed to the root element so additional attributes like role and aria-live can be used to define live regions. Keyboard Support Component does not include any interactive elements.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: The element to block should be placed as a child of BlockUI and blocked property is required to control the state.

components.name: breadcrumb
components.title: Angular Breadcrumb Component
components.description: Breadcrumb provides contextual information about page hierarchy.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Breadcrumb uses the nav element and since any attribute is passed to the root implicitly aria-labelledby or aria-label can be used to describe the component. Inside an ordered list is used where the list item separators have aria-hidden to be able to ignored by the screen readers. If the last link represents the current route, aria-current is added with "page" as the value. Keyboard Support No special keyboard interaction is needed, all menuitems are focusable based on the page tab sequence.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Breadcrumb provides contextual information about page hierarchy.

examples.basic: <p-breadcrumb [model]="items" [home]="home" />

sections.label: Router
sections.description: Menu items support navigation via routerLink, programmatic routing using commands, or external URLs.

examples.basic: <p-breadcrumb [home]="home" [model]="items" />

sections.label: Template
sections.description: Custom content can be placed inside the items using the item template. The divider between the items has its own separator template.

examples.basic: /
examples.html: /

components.name: button
components.title: Angular Button Component
components.description: Button is an extension to standard button element with icons and theming.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Button component renders a native button element that implicitly includes any passed prop. Text to describe the button is defined with the aria-label prop, if not present label prop is used as the value. If the button is icon only or custom templating is used, it is recommended to use aria-label so that screen readers would be able to read the element properly.

examples.basic: Youtube

sections.label: Badge
sections.description: Buttons have built-in badge support with badge and badgeClass properties.

examples.basic:
<p-button label="Emails" badge="2" styleClass="m-0" />
<p-button label="Messages" icon="pi pi-users" badge="2" badgeSeverity="contrast" styleClass="m-0" [outlined]="true" />

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Text to display on a button is defined with the label property.

examples.basic: <p-button label="Submit" />

sections.label: Button Group
sections.description: Multiple buttons are grouped when wrapped inside an element with ButtonGroup component.

examples.basic:
<p-buttongroup>
    <p-button label="Save" icon="pi pi-check" />
    <p-button label="Delete" icon="pi pi-trash" />
    <p-button label="Cancel" icon="pi pi-times" />
</p-buttongroup>

sections.label: buttonset-doc
sections.description: Multiple buttons are grouped when wrapped inside an element with p-buttonset class.

sections.label: Directive
sections.description: Button can also be used as directive using pButton along with pButtonLabel and pButtonIcon helper directives.

sections.label: Disabled
sections.description: When disabled is present, the element cannot be edited and focused.

examples.basic: <p-button label="Submit" [disabled]="true" />

sections.label: Icons
sections.description: Icon of a button is specified with icon property and position is configured using iconPos attribute.

sections.label: iconsonly-doc
sections.description: Buttons can have icons without labels.

`, standalone: true, imports: [ButtonModule] }) export class ButtonIconsonlyDemo {}

sections.description: A button can be rendered as a link when link property is present, while the pButton directive can be applied on an anchor element to style the link as a button.

components.name: card
components.title: Angular Card Component
components.description: Card is a flexible container component.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader A card can be utilized in many use cases as a result no role is enforced, in fact a role may not be necessary if the card is used for presentational purposes only. Any valid attribute is passed to the container element so if you require to use one of the landmark roles like region , you may use the role property. Keyboard Support Component does not include any interactive elements.

sections.label: Advanced
sections.description: Card content can be customized further with subHeader , header and footer properties.

components.name: carousel
components.title: Angular Carousel Component
components.description: Carousel is a content slider featuring various customization options.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Carousel uses region role and since any attribute is passed to the main container element, attributes such as aria-label and aria-roledescription can be used as well. The slides container has aria-live attribute set as "polite" if carousel is not in autoplay mode, otherwise "off" would be the value in autoplay. A slide has a group role with an aria-label that refers to the aria.slideNumber property of the locale API. Similarly aria.slide is used as the aria-roledescription of the item. Inactive slides are hidden from the readers with aria-hidden . Next and Previous navigators are button elements with aria-label attributes referring to the aria.nextPageLabel and aria.firstPageLabel properties of the locale API by default respectively, you may still use your own aria roles and attributes as any valid attribute is passed to the button elements implicitly by using nextButtonProps and prevButtonProps . Quick navigation elements are button elements with an aria-label attribute referring to the aria.pageLabel of the locale API. Current page is marked with aria-current . Next/Prev Keyboard Support Key Function tab Moves focus through interactive elements in the carousel. enter Activates navigation. space Activates navigation. Quick Navigation Keyboard Support Key Function tab Moves focus through the active slide link. enter Activates the focused slide link. space Activates the focused slide link. right arrow Moves focus to the next slide link. left arrow Moves focus to the previous slide link. home Moves focus to the first slide link. end Moves focus to the last slide link.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Carousel requires a collection of items as its value along with a template to render each item.

examples.basic:
{{ product.name }}
{{ '$' + product.price }}
examples.html:
{{ product.name }}
{{ '$' + product.price }}

sections.label: Circular
sections.description: When autoplayInterval is defined in milliseconds, items are scrolled automatically. In addition, for infinite scrolling circular property needs to be added which is enabled automatically in auto play mode.

examples.basic:

{{ '$' + product.price }}
examples.html:

{{ '$' + product.price }}

sections.label: Responsive
sections.description: Carousel supports specific configuration per screen size with the responsiveOptions property that takes an array of objects where each object defines the max-width breakpoint , numVisible for the number of items items per page and numScroll for number of items to scroll. When responsiveOptions is defined, the numScroll and numVisible properties of the Carousel are used as default when there is breakpoint that applies.

components.name: cascadeselect
components.title: Angular CascadeSelect Component
components.description: CascadeSelect displays a nested structure of options.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Value to describe the component can either be provided with ariaLabelledBy or ariaLabel props. The cascadeselect element has a combobox role in addition to aria-haspopup and aria-expanded attributes. The relation between the combobox and the popup is created with aria-controls that refers to the id of the popup. The popup list has an id that refers to the aria-controls attribute of the combobox element and uses tree as the role. Each list item has a treeitem role along with aria-label , aria-selected and aria-expanded attributes. The container element of a treenode has the group role. The aria-setsize , aria-posinset and aria-level attributes are calculated implicitly and added to each treeitem.

examples.basic: Options

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: CascadeSelect requires a value to bind and a collection of arbitrary objects with a nested hierarchy. optionGroupLabel is used for the text of a category and optionGroupChildren is to define the children of the category. Note that order of the optionGroupChildren matters and it should correspond to the data hierarchy.

examples.basic: <p-cascadeselect [(ngModel)]="selectedCity" [options]="countries" optionLabel="cname" optionGroupLabel="name" [optionGroupChildren]="['states', 'cities']" [style]="{ minWidth: '14rem' }" placeholder="Select a City" />

sections.label: Clear Icon
sections.description: When showClear is enabled, a clear icon is displayed to clear the value.

examples.basic: <p-cascadeselect [(ngModel)]="selectedCity" [options]="countries" optionLabel="cname" optionGroupLabel="name" [optionGroupChildren]="['states', 'cities']" placeholder="Select a City" [style]="{ minWidth: '14rem' }" [showClear]="true" />

sections.label: Disabled
sections.description: When disabled is present, the element cannot be edited and focused.

examples.basic: <p-cascadeselect [disabled]="true" placeholder="Disabled" [style]="{ minWidth: '14rem' }" />

sections.label: Filled
sections.description: Specify the variant property as filled to display the component with a higher visual emphasis than the default outlined style.

examples.basic: <p-cascadeselect [(ngModel)]="selectedCity" variant="filled" [options]="countries" optionLabel="cname" optionGroupLabel="name" [optionGroupChildren]="['states', 'cities']" [style]="{ minWidth: '14rem' }" placeholder="Select a City" />

sections.label: floatlabel-doc
sections.description: A floating label appears on top of the input field when focused. Visit FloatLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<p-floatlabel class="w-full md:w-56">
    <p-cascadeselect [(ngModel)]="value1" inputId="over_label" [options]="countries" optionLabel="cname" optionGroupLabel="name" [optionGroupChildren]="['states', 'cities']" class="w-full" />
    <label for="over_label">Over Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>
<p-floatlabel class="w-full md:w-56" variant="in">
    <p-cascadeselect [(ngModel)]="value2" inputId="in_label" [options]="countries" optionLabel="cname" optionGroupLabel="name" [optionGroupChildren]="['states', 'cities']" class="w-full" />
    <label for="in_label">In Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>
<p-floatlabel class="w-full md:w-56" variant="on">
    <p-cascadeselect [(ngModel)]="value3" inputId="on_label" [options]="countries" optionLabel="cname" optionGroupLabel="name" [optionGroupChildren]="['states', 'cities']" class="w-full" />
    <label for="on_label">On Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>

sections.label: Fluid
sections.description: The fluid prop makes the component take up the full width of its container when set to true.

examples.basic: <p-cascadeselect [(ngModel)]="selectedCity" [options]="countries" optionLabel="cname" optionGroupLabel="name" [optionGroupChildren]="['states', 'cities']" placeholder="Select a City" fluid />

sections.label: iftalabel-doc
sections.description: IftaLabel is used to create infield top aligned labels. Visit IftaLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<p-iftalabel class="w-full md:w-56">
    <p-cascadeselect [(ngModel)]="selectedCity" inputId="cs_city" [options]="countries" optionLabel="cname" optionGroupLabel="name" [optionGroupChildren]="['states', 'cities']" class="w-full" />
    <label for="cs_city">City</label>
</p-iftalabel>

sections.label: Invalid
sections.description: The invalid state is applied using the invalid property to indicate failed validation, which can be integrated with Angular Forms.

examples.basic:
<p-cascadeselect [(ngModel)]="selectedCity1" [invalid]="!selectedCity1" [options]="countries" optionLabel="cname" optionGroupLabel="name" [optionGroupChildren]="['states', 'cities']" class="w-full sm:w-56" placeholder="Select a City" />
<p-cascadeselect
    [(ngModel)]="selectedCity2"
    [invalid]="!selectedCity2"
    [options]="countries"
    optionLabel="cname"
    optionGroupLabel="name"
    [optionGroupChildren]="['states', 'cities']"
    class="w-full sm:w-56"
    placeholder="Select a City"
    variant="filled"
/>

sections.label: Loading State
sections.description: Loading state can be used loading property.

examples.basic: <p-cascadeselect [loading]="true" [style]="{ minWidth: '14rem' }" placeholder="Loading..." />

sections.label: reactiveforms-doc
sections.description: CascadeSelect can also be used with reactive forms. In this case, the formControlName property is used to bind the component to a form control.

examples.basic: @if (isInvalid('selectedCity')) { City is required. }
examples.html: @if (isInvalid('selectedCity')) { City is required. }

sections.label: Sizes
sections.description: CascadeSelect provides small and large sizes as alternatives to the base.

examples.basic:
<p-cascadeselect [(ngModel)]="value1" [options]="countries" optionLabel="cname" optionGroupLabel="name" [optionGroupChildren]="['states', 'cities']" class="w-56" size="small" placeholder="Small" />
<p-cascadeselect [(ngModel)]="value2" [options]="countries" optionLabel="cname" optionGroupLabel="name" [optionGroupChildren]="['states', 'cities']" class="w-56" placeholder="Normal" />
<p-cascadeselect [(ngModel)]="value3" [options]="countries" optionLabel="cname" optionGroupLabel="name" [optionGroupChildren]="['states', 'cities']" class="w-56" size="large" placeholder="Large" />

sections.label: Template
sections.description: Label of an option is used as the display text of an item by default, for custom content support define an option template that gets the option instance as a parameter. In addition value , dropdownicon , loadingicon , and optiongroupicon slots are provided for further customization.

examples.basic:
{{ option.cname || option.name }}
Available Countries
examples.html:
{{ option.cname || option.name }}
Available Countries

examples.basic: @if (city.invalid && (city.touched || exampleForm.submitted)) { City is required. }
examples.html: @if (city.invalid && (city.touched || exampleForm.submitted)) { City is required. }

components.name: chart
components.title: Angular Chart Component
components.description: Chart components are based on Charts.js 3.3.2+, an open source HTML5 based charting library.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Chart components internally use canvas element, refer to the Chart.js accessibility guide for more information.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: A chart is configured with 3 properties; type , data and options . Chart type is defined using the type property that accepts pie , doughtnut , line , bar , radar and polarArea as a value. The data defines datasets represented with the chart and the options provide numerous customization options to customize the presentation.

examples.basic: <p-chart type="bar" [data]="basicData" [options]="basicOptions" />

sections.label: Chart.js
sections.description: To begin with, first you must install the charts.js package using npm and then include it in your project. An example with CLI would be;

sections.label: Combo
sections.description: Different chart types can be combined in the same graph using the type option of a dataset.

examples.basic: <p-chart type="line" [data]="data" [options]="options" class="h-[30rem]" />

sections.label: Doughnut
sections.description: A doughnut chart is a variant of the pie chart, with a blank center allowing for additional information about the data as a whole to be included.

examples.basic: <p-chart type="doughnut" [data]="data" [options]="options" class="w-full md:w-[30rem]" />

sections.label: Horizontal Bar
sections.description: A bar chart is rendered horizontally when indexAxis option is set as y .

examples.basic: <p-chart type="bar" [data]="data" [options]="options" class="h-[30rem]" />

sections.label: Line
sections.description: A line chart or line graph is a type of chart which displays information as a series of data points called 'markers' connected by straight line segments.

examples.basic: <p-chart type="line" [data]="data" [options]="options" class="h-[30rem]" />

sections.label: linestyle-doc
sections.description: Various styles of a line series can be customized to display customizations like an area chart.

examples.basic: <p-chart type="line" [data]="data" [options]="options" class="h-[30rem]" />

Name Parameters Description
refresh - Redraws the graph with new data.
reinit - Destroys the graph first and then creates it again.
generateLegend - Returns an HTML string of a legend for that chart. The legend is generated from the legendCallback in the options.
examples.html:
Name Parameters Description
refresh - Redraws the graph with new data.
reinit - Destroys the graph first and then creates it again.
generateLegend - Returns an HTML string of a legend for that chart. The legend is generated from the legendCallback in the options.
examples.typescript:
import { Component } from '@angular/core'; @Component({ template: `
Name Parameters Description
refresh - Redraws the graph with new data.
reinit - Destroys the graph first and then creates it again.
generateLegend - Returns an HTML string of a legend for that chart. The legend is generated from the legendCallback in the options.
`, standalone: true, imports: [] }) export class ChartMethodsDemo {}

sections.label: MultiAxis
sections.description: Multiple axes can be added using the scales option.

examples.basic: <p-chart type="line" [data]="data" [options]="options" class="h-[30rem]" />

sections.label: Pie
sections.description: A pie chart is a circular statistical graphic which is divided into slices to illustrate numerical proportion.

examples.basic: <p-chart type="pie" [data]="data" [options]="options" class="w-full md:w-[30rem]" />

sections.label: Polar Area
sections.description: Polar area charts are similar to pie charts, but each segment has the same angle - the radius of the segment differs depending on the value.

examples.basic: <p-chart type="polarArea" [data]="data" [options]="options" class="w-full md:w-[30rem]" />

sections.label: radar-doc
sections.description: A radar chart is a graphical method of displaying multivariate data in the form of a two-dimensional chart of three or more quantitative variables represented on axes starting from the same point.

examples.basic: <p-chart type="radar" [data]="data" [options]="options" class="w-full md:w-[30rem]" />

sections.label: Stacked Bar
sections.description: Bars can be stacked on top of each other when stacked option of a scale is enabled.

examples.basic: <p-chart type="bar" [data]="data" [options]="options" class="h-[30rem]" />

sections.label: Vertical Bar
sections.description: A bar chart or bar graph is a chart that presents grouped data with rectangular bars with lengths proportional to the values that they represent.

examples.basic: <p-chart type="bar" [data]="data" [options]="options" class="h-[30rem]" />

components.name: checkbox
components.title: Angular Checkbox Component
components.description: Checkbox is an extension to standard checkbox element with theming.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Checkbox component uses a hidden native checkbox element internally that is only visible to screen readers. Value to describe the component can either be provided via label tag combined with inputId prop or using ariaLabelledBy , ariaLabel props.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Binary checkbox is used as a controlled input with ngModel and binary properties.

examples.basic: <p-checkbox [(ngModel)]="checked" [binary]="true" />

sections.label: Disabled
sections.description: When disabled is present, the element cannot be edited and focused.

examples.basic:
<p-checkbox [(ngModel)]="checked1" [binary]="true" [disabled]="true" />
<p-checkbox [(ngModel)]="checked2" [binary]="true" [disabled]="true" />

sections.label: Dynamic
sections.description: Checkboxes can be generated using a list of values.

sections.label: Filled
sections.description: Specify the variant property as filled to display the component with a higher visual emphasis than the default outlined style.

examples.basic: <p-checkbox [(ngModel)]="checked" [binary]="true" variant="filled" />

sections.label: Indeterminate
sections.description: The indeterminate state indicates that a checkbox is neither "on" or "off".

examples.basic: <p-checkbox [(ngModel)]="checked" [binary]="true" [indeterminate]="true" />

sections.label: Invalid
sections.description: The invalid state is applied using the invalid property to indicate failed validation, which can be integrated with Angular Forms.

examples.basic: <p-checkbox [(ngModel)]="checked" [binary]="true" [invalid]="!checked" />

sections.label: label-doc
sections.description: The label attribute provides a label text for the checkbox. This label is also clickable and toggles the checked state.

examples.basic:
<p-checkbox name="groupname" value="val1" label="Value 1" [(ngModel)]="selectedValues"></p-checkbox>
<p-checkbox name="groupname" value="val2" label="Value 2" [(ngModel)]="selectedValues"></p-checkbox>

sections.label: multiple-doc
sections.description: Multiple checkboxes can be grouped together.

sections.label: reactiveforms-doc
sections.description: Checkbox can also be used with reactive forms. In this case, the formControlName property is used to bind the component to a form control.

examples.basic:
@for (item of formKeys; track item) {
}
@if (hasAnyInvalid()) { At least one ingredient must be selected. }
examples.html:
@for (item of formKeys; track item) {
}
@if (hasAnyInvalid()) { At least one ingredient must be selected. }

sections.label: Sizes
sections.description: Checkbox provides small and large sizes as alternatives to the base.

examples.basic:
@for (item of formKeys; track item) {
}
@if (isInvalid()) { At least one ingredient must be selected. }
examples.html:
@for (item of formKeys; track item) {
}
@if (isInvalid()) { At least one ingredient must be selected. }

components.name: chip
components.title: Angular Chip Component
components.description: Chip represents entities using icons, labels and images.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Chip uses the label property as the default aria-label , since any attribute is passed to the root element aria-labelledby or aria-label can be used to override the default behavior. Removable chips have a tabindex and focusable with the tab key. Keyboard Support Key Function backspace Hides removable. enter Hides removable.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: A basic chip with a text is created with the label property. In addition when removable is added, a delete icon is displayed to remove a chip, the optional onRemove event is available to get notified when a chip is hidden.

examples.basic:
<p-chip label="Action" />
<p-chip label="Comedy" />
<p-chip label="Mystery" />
<p-chip label="Thriller" [removable]="true" />

sections.label: Icon
sections.description: A font icon next to the label can be displayed with the icon property.

examples.basic:
<p-chip label="Apple" icon="pi pi-apple" />
<p-chip label="Facebook" icon="pi pi-facebook" />
<p-chip label="Google" icon="pi pi-google" />
<p-chip label="Microsoft" icon="pi pi-microsoft" [removable]="true" />

sections.label: Image
sections.description: The image property is used to display an image like an avatar.

examples.basic:
<p-chip label="Amy Elsner" image="https://primefaces.org/cdn/primeng/images/demo/avatar/amyelsner.png" alt="Avatar image" />
<p-chip label="Asiya Javayant" image="https://primefaces.org/cdn/primeng/images/demo/avatar/asiyajavayant.png" alt="Avatar image" />
<p-chip label="Onyama Limba" image="https://primefaces.org/cdn/primeng/images/demo/avatar/onyamalimba.png" alt="Avatar image" />
<p-chip label="Xuxue Feng" image="https://primefaces.org/cdn/primeng/images/demo/avatar/xuxuefeng.png" alt="Avatar image" [removable]="true" />

sections.label: Template
sections.description: Content can easily be customized with the dynamic content instead of using the built-in modes.

examples.basic: P PRIME
examples.html: P PRIME

components.name: colorpicker
components.title: Angular ColorPicker Component
components.description: ColorPicker is an input component to select a color.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Specification does not cover a color picker yet and using a semantic native color picker is not consistent across browsers so currently component is not compatible with screen readers. In the upcoming versions, text fields will be introduced below the slider section to be able to pick a color using accessible text boxes in hsl, rgba and hex formats.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: ColorPicker is used as a controlled input with ngModel property.

examples.basic: <p-colorpicker [(ngModel)]="color" />

sections.label: Disabled
sections.description: When disabled is present, the element cannot be edited and focused.

examples.basic: <p-colorpicker [(ngModel)]="color" [disabled]="true" />

sections.label: Format
sections.description: Default color format to use in value binding is hex and other possible values can be rgb and hsb using the format property.

examples.basic:
{{ color }}
{{ 'r:' + colorRGB.r + ' g:' + colorRGB.g + ' b:' + colorRGB.b }}
{{ 'h:' + colorHSB.h + ' s:' + colorHSB.s + ' b:' + colorHSB.b }}
examples.html:
{{ color }}
{{ 'r:' + colorRGB.r + ' g:' + colorRGB.g + ' b:' + colorRGB.b }}
{{ 'h:' + colorHSB.h + ' s:' + colorHSB.s + ' b:' + colorHSB.b }}

sections.label: Inline
sections.description: ColorPicker is displayed as a popup by default, add inline property to customize this behavior.

examples.basic: <p-colorpicker [(ngModel)]="color" [inline]="true" />

sections.label: reactiveforms-doc
sections.description: ColorPicker can also be used with reactive forms. In this case, the formControlName property is used to bind the component to a form control.

examples.basic: @if (isInvalid('color')) { Color is required. }
examples.html: @if (isInvalid('color')) { Color is required. }

examples.basic: @if (colorModel.invalid && (colorModel.touched || exampleForm.submitted)) { Color is required. }
examples.html: @if (colorModel.invalid && (colorModel.touched || exampleForm.submitted)) { Color is required. }

components.name: confirmdialog
components.title: Angular ConfirmDialog Component
components.description: ConfirmDialog is backed by a service utilizing Observables to display confirmation windows easily that can be shared by multiple actions on the same component.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader ConfirmDialog component uses alertdialog role along with aria-labelledby referring to the header element however any attribute is passed to the root element so you may use aria-labelledby to override this default behavior. In addition aria-modal is added since focus is kept within the popup. It is recommended to use a trigger component that can be accessed with keyboard such as a button, if not adding tabIndex would be necessary. When confirm function is used and a trigger is passed as a parameter, ConfirmDialog adds aria-expanded state attribute and aria-controls to the trigger so that the relation between the trigger and the popup is defined. If the dialog is controlled with the visible property aria-expanded and aria-controls need to be handled explicitly. Overlay Keyboard Support Key Function tab Moves focus to the next the focusable element within the popup. shift + tab Moves focus to the previous the focusable element within the popup. escape Closes the popup and moves focus to the trigger. Buttons Keyboard Support Key Function enter Triggers the action, closes the popup and moves focus to the trigger. space Triggers the action, closes the popup and moves focus to the trigger.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: ConfirmDialog is defined using p-confirmdialog tag and an instance of ConfirmationService is required to display it bycalling confirm method.

examples.basic:
<p-toast />
<p-confirmdialog />
<p-button (click)="confirm1($event)" label="Save" [outlined]="true" />
<p-button (click)="confirm2($event)" label="Delete" severity="danger" [outlined]="true" />

sections.label: Headless
sections.description: Headless mode allows you to customize the entire user interface instead of the default elements.

examples.basic:
@if (message) {
{{ message.header }}

{{ message.message }}

}
examples.html:
@if (message) {
{{ message.header }}

{{ message.message }}

}

sections.label: Position
sections.description: The position property of the confirm options is used to display a Dialog at all edges and corners of the screen.

sections.label: Template
sections.description: Properties of the dialog are defined in two ways, message , icon , header properties can either be defined using confirm method or declaratively on p-confirmDialog ng-template by header , message , icon and footer templates. If these values are unlikely to change then declarative approach would be useful, still properties defined in a ng-template can be overridden with confirm method call. In addition, buttons at footer section can be customized by passing your own UI, important note to make confirmation work with a custom UI is defining a local ng-template variable for the dialog and assign accept()-reject() methods to your own buttons.

examples.basic:
@if (message) {

{{ message.message }}

}
examples.html:
@if (message) {

{{ message.message }}

}

components.name: confirmpopup
components.title: Angular ConfirmPopup Component
components.description: ConfirmPopup displays a confirmation overlay displayed relatively to its target.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader ConfirmPopup component uses alertdialog role and since any attribute is passed to the root element you may define attributes like aria-label or aria-labelledby to describe the popup contents. In addition aria-modal is added since focus is kept within the popup. It is recommended to use a trigger component that can be accessed with keyboard such as a button, if not adding tabIndex would be necessary. ConfirmPopup adds aria-expanded state attribute and aria-controls to the trigger so that the relation between the trigger and the popup is defined. Overlay Keyboard Support When the popup gets opened, the first focusable element receives the focus and this can be customized by adding autofocus to an element within the popup. Key Function tab Moves focus to the next the focusable element within the popup. shift + tab Moves focus to the previous the focusable element within the popup. escape Closes the popup and moves focus to the trigger. Buttons Keyboard Support Key Function enter Triggers the action, closes the popup and moves focus to the trigger. space Triggers the action, closes the popup and moves focus to the trigger.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: ConfirmPopup is defined using p-confirmPopup tag and an instance of ConfirmationService is required to display it bycalling confirm method.

examples.basic:
<p-toast />
<p-confirmpopup />
<p-button (onClick)="confirm1($event)" label="Save" [outlined]="true" />
<p-button (onClick)="confirm2($event)" label="Delete" severity="danger" [outlined]="true" />

Name Type Default Description
message string null Message of the confirmation.
key string null Optional key to match the key of the confirm popup, necessary to use when component tree has multiple confirm popups.
icon string null Icon to display next to the message.
accept Function null Callback to execute when action is confirmed.
reject Function null Callback to execute when action is rejected.
acceptLabel string null Label of the accept button.
rejectLabel string null Label of the reject button.
acceptIcon string null Icon of the accept button.
rejectIcon string null Icon of the reject button.
acceptVisible boolean true Visibility of the accept button.
rejectVisible boolean true Visibility of the reject button.
acceptButtonStyleClass string null Style class of the accept button.
rejectButtonStyleClass string null Style class of the reject button.
defaultFocus string accept Element to receive the focus when the popup gets visible, valid values are "accept", "reject", and "none".

components.name: contextmenu
components.title: Angular ContextMenu Component
components.description: ContextMenu displays an overlay menu on right click of its target.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader ContextMenu component uses the menubar role with aria-orientation set to "vertical" and the value to describe the menu can either be provided with aria-labelledby or aria-label props. Each list item has a presentation role whereas anchor elements have a menuitem role with aria-label referring to the label of the item and aria-disabled defined if the item is disabled. A submenu within a ContextMenu uses the menu role with an aria-labelledby defined as the id of the submenu root menuitem label. In addition, menuitems that open a submenu have aria-haspopup , aria-expanded and aria-controls to define the relation between the item and the submenu. Keyboard Support Key Function tab When focus is in the menu, closes the context menu and moves focus to the next focusable element in the page sequence. enter If menuitem has a submenu, toggles the visibility of the submenu otherwise activates the menuitem and closes all open overlays. space If menuitem has a submenu, toggles the visibility of the submenu otherwise activates the menuitem and closes all open overlays. escape Closes the context menu. down arrow If focus is not inside the menu and menu is open, add focus to the first item. If an item is already focused, moves focus to the next menuitem within the submenu. up arrow If focus is not inside the menu and menu is open, add focus to the last item. If an item is already focused, moves focus to the next menuitem within the submenu. right arrow Opens a submenu if there is one available and moves focus to the first item. left arrow Closes a submenu and moves focus to the root item of the closed submenu. home Moves focus to the first menuitem within the submenu. end Moves focus to the last menuitem within the submenu.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: ContextMenu can be attached to a particular element whose local template variable name is defined using the target property.

sections.label: Command
sections.description: The function to invoke when an item is clicked is defined using the command property.

examples.html: • {{ user.name }}

examples.basic: Right-Click anywhere on this page to view the global ContextMenu.

sections.label: Router
sections.description: Menu items support navigation via routerLink, programmatic routing using commands, or external URLs.

sections.label: Table
sections.description: Table has built-in support for ContextMenu, see the ContextMenu demo for an example.

sections.label: Template
sections.description: ContextMenu offers item customization with the item template that receives the menuitem instance from the model as a parameter.

components.name: dataview
components.title: Angular DataView Component
components.description: DataView displays data in grid grid-cols-12 gap-4 or list layout with pagination and sorting features.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader The container element that wraps the layout options buttons has a group role whereas each button element uses button role and aria-pressed is updated depending on selection state. Values to describe the buttons are derived from the aria.listView and aria.gridView properties of the locale API respectively. Refer to paginator accessibility documentation for the paginator of the component. Keyboard Support Key Function tab Moves focus to the buttons. space Toggles the checked state of a button.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: DataView requires a value to display along with a list template that receives an object in the collection to return content.

sections.description: DataView supports list and grid display modes defined with the layout property. The grid mode is not built-in for flexibility purposes and requires a library with CSS grid features like Tailwind.

components.name: datepicker
components.title: Angular DatePicker Component
components.description: DatePicker is an input component to select a date.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Value to describe the component can either be provided via label tag combined with inputId prop or using aria-labelledby , aria-label props. The input element has combobox role in addition to aria-autocomplete as "none", aria-haspopup as "dialog" and aria-expanded attributes. The relation between the input and the popup is created with aria-controls attribute that refers to the id of the popup. The optional DatePicker button requires includes aria-haspopup , aria-expanded for states along with aria-controls to define the relation between the popup and the button. The value to read is retrieved from the chooseDate key of the aria property from the locale API. This label is also used for the aria-label of the popup as well. When there is a value selected, it is formatted and appended to the label to be able to notify users about the current value. Popup has a dialog role along with aria-modal and aria-label . The navigation buttons at the header has an aria-label retrieved from the prevYear , nextYear , prevMonth , nextMonth , prevDecade and nextDecade keys of the locale aria API. Similarly month picker button uses the chooseMonth and year picker button uses the chooseYear keys. Main date table uses grid role that contains th elements with col as the scope along with abbr tag resolving to the full name of the month. Each date cell has an aria-label referring to the full date value. Buttons at the footer utilize their readable labels as aria-label as well. Selected date also receives the aria-selected attribute. Timepicker spinner buttons get their labels for aria-label from the aria locale API using the prevHour , nextHour , prevMinute , nextMinute , prevSecond , nextSecond , am and pm keys. DatePicker also includes a hidden section that is only available to screen readers with aria-live as "polite". This element is updated when the selected date changes to instruct the user about the current date selected.

examples.basic: Date

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Two-way value binding is defined using the standard ngModel directive referencing to a Date property.

examples.basic: <p-datepicker [(ngModel)]="date" />

sections.label: Button Bar
sections.description: When showButtonBar is present, today and clear buttons are displayed at the footer. The content can be fully customized with the buttonbar template as well.

sections.label: Clear Icon
sections.description: When showClear is enabled, a clear icon is displayed to clear the value.

examples.basic: <p-datepicker [(ngModel)]="date" [showClear]="true" inputStyleClass="w-56" />

sections.label: Date Template
sections.description: Custom content can be placed inside date cells with the ng-template property that takes a Date as a parameter.

examples.basic: {{ date.day }} {{ date.day }}
examples.html: {{ date.day }} {{ date.day }}

sections.label: Disabled
sections.description: When disabled is present, the element cannot be edited and focused.

examples.basic: <p-datepicker [(ngModel)]="date" [disabled]="true" />

Name Parameters Description
onSelect value: Selected value Callback to invoke when a date is selected. Note that this event is not called when the value is entered from the input manually.
onBlur event: Blur event Callback to invoke on blur of input field.
onFocus event: Focus event Callback to invoke on focus of input field.
onClose event: Close event Callback to invoke when datepicker panel is closed.
onShow event: Animation event Callback to invoke when datepicker panel is visible.
onClickOutside event: Click event Callback to invoke when click outside of datepicker panel.
onInput event: Input event Callback to invoke when input field is being typed.
onTodayClick event: Click event Callback to invoke when today button is clicked.
onClearClick event: Click event Callback to invoke when clear button is clicked.
onMonthChange event.month: New month
event.year: New year 		Callback to invoke when a month is changed using the navigators.
onYearChange event.month: New month
event.year: New year 		Callback to invoke when a year is changed using the navigators.
onClear - Callback to invoke when input field is cleared.

sections.label: Filled
sections.description: Specify the variant property as filled to display the component with a higher visual emphasis than the default outlined style.

examples.basic: <p-datepicker [(ngModel)]="date" variant="filled" />

sections.label: Float Label
sections.description: A floating label appears on top of the input field when focused. Visit FloatLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<p-floatlabel>
    <p-datepicker [(ngModel)]="value1" inputId="over_label" showIcon iconDisplay="input" />
    <label for="over_label">Over Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>
<p-floatlabel variant="in">
    <p-datepicker [(ngModel)]="value2" inputId="in_label" showIcon iconDisplay="input" />
    <label for="in_label">In Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>
<p-floatlabel variant="on">
    <p-datepicker [(ngModel)]="value3" inputId="on_label" showIcon iconDisplay="input" />
    <label for="on_label">On Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>

sections.label: Fluid
sections.description: The fluid prop makes the component take up the full width of its container when set to true.

examples.basic: <p-datepicker [(ngModel)]="date" fluid />

sections.label: Format
sections.description: Default date format is mm/dd/yy which can be customized using the dateFormat property. Following options can be a part of the format. d - day of month (no leading zero) dd - day of month (two digit) o - day of the year (no leading zeros) oo - day of the year (three digit) D - day name short DD - day name long m - month of year (no leading zero) mm - month of year (two digit) M - month name short MM - month name long y - year (two digit) yy - year (four digit) @ - Unix timestamp (ms since 01/01/1970) ! - Windows ticks (100ns since 01/01/0001) '...' - literal text '' - single quote anything else - literal text

examples.basic: <p-datepicker [(ngModel)]="date" dateFormat="dd.mm.yy" />

sections.label: Icon
sections.description: An additional icon is displayed next to the input field when showIcon is present.

sections.label: Ifta Label
sections.description: IftaLabel is used to create infield top aligned labels. Visit IftaLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<p-iftalabel>
    <p-datepicker [(ngModel)]="value" inputId="date" showIcon iconDisplay="input" />
    <label for="date">Date</label>
</p-iftalabel>

sections.label: Inline
sections.description: DatePicker is displayed as a popup by default, add inline property to customize this behavior.

examples.basic: <p-datepicker class="max-w-full" [(ngModel)]="date" [inline]="true" [showWeek]="true" />

sections.label: Invalid
sections.description: The invalid state is applied using the invalid property to indicate failed validation, which can be integrated with Angular Forms.

examples.basic:
<p-datepicker [(ngModel)]="date1" [invalid]="!date1" placeholder="Date" />
<p-datepicker [(ngModel)]="date2" [invalid]="!date2" variant="filled" placeholder="Date" />

sections.label: Locale
sections.description: Locale for different languages and formats is defined globally, refer to the PrimeNG Locale configuration for more information.

examples.basic:
Name Parameters Description
toggle - Toggles the visibility of the calendar.
examples.html:
Name Parameters Description
toggle - Toggles the visibility of the calendar.
examples.typescript:
import { Component } from '@angular/core'; @Component({ template: `
Name Parameters Description
toggle - Toggles the visibility of the calendar.
`, standalone: true, imports: [] }) export class DatepickerMethodsDemo {}

sections.label: minmaxdox
sections.description: Boundaries for the permitted dates that can be entered are defined with minDate and maxDate properties.

sections.label: month-doc
sections.description: Month only picker is enabled by specifying view as month in addition to a suitable dateFormat .

examples.basic: <p-datepicker [(ngModel)]="date" view="month" dateFormat="mm/yy" [readonlyInput]="true" />

sections.label: Multiple
sections.description: In order to choose multiple dates, set selectionMode as multiple . In this mode, the value binding should be an array.

examples.basic: <p-datepicker [(ngModel)]="dates" selectionMode="multiple" [readonlyInput]="true" />

sections.label: multiplemonths.-doc
sections.description: Number of months to display is configured with the numberOfMonths property.

examples.basic: <p-datepicker [(ngModel)]="date" [numberOfMonths]="2" />

sections.label: Range
sections.description: A range of dates can be selected by defining selectionMode as range , in this case the bound value would be an array with two values where first date is the start of the range and second date is the end.

examples.basic: <p-datepicker [(ngModel)]="rangeDates" selectionMode="range" [readonlyInput]="true" />

sections.label: reactiveforms-doc
sections.description: DatePicker can also be used with reactive forms. In this case, the formControlName property is used to bind the component to a form control.

examples.basic: @if (isInvalid('selectedDate')) { Date is required. }
examples.html: @if (isInvalid('selectedDate')) { Date is required. }

sections.label: Sizes
sections.description: DatePicker provides small and large sizes as alternatives to the base.

examples.basic:
<p-datepicker [(ngModel)]="value1" size="small" placeholder="Small" showIcon iconDisplay="input" />
<p-datepicker [(ngModel)]="value2" placeholder="Normal" showIcon iconDisplay="input" />
<p-datepicker [(ngModel)]="value3" size="large" placeholder="Large" showIcon iconDisplay="input" />

sections.label: template-doc
sections.description: Calendar UI accepts custom content using header and footer templates.

examples.basic:
<p-calendar [(ngModel)]="date">
    <ng-template #header>Header</ng-template>
    <ng-template #footer>Footer</ng-template>
</p-calendar>
examples.html: Header Footer

examples.basic: @if (dateModel.invalid && (dateModel.touched || exampleForm.submitted)) { Date is required. }
examples.html: @if (dateModel.invalid && (dateModel.touched || exampleForm.submitted)) { Date is required. }

header -
footer -

decade $implicit: An array containing the start and and year of a decade to display at header of the year picker.
