sections.label: Time
sections.description: A time picker is displayed when showTime is enabled where 12/24 hour format is configured with hourFormat property. In case, only time needs to be selected, add timeOnly to hide the date section.

sections.label: touchui-doc
sections.description: When touchUI is enabled, overlay is displayed as optimized for touch devices.

examples.basic: <p-datepicker [(ngModel)]="date" [touchUI]="true" [readonlyInput]="true" />

sections.label: year-doc
sections.description: Specifying view as year in addition to a suitable dateFormat enables the year picker.

examples.basic: <p-datepicker [(ngModel)]="date" view="year" dateFormat="yy" />

props.name: dt
props.description: Defines scoped design tokens of the component.

props.name: unstyled
props.description: Indicates whether the component should be rendered without styles.

props.name: pt
props.description: Used to pass attributes to DOM elements inside the component.

props.name: ptOptions
props.description: Used to configure passthrough(pt) options of the component.

props.name: required
props.description: There must be a value (if set).

props.name: invalid
props.description: When present, it specifies that the component should have invalid state style.

props.name: disabled
props.description: When present, it specifies that the component should have disabled state style.

props.name: name
props.description: When present, it specifies that the name of the input.

props.name: fluid
props.description: Spans 100% width of the container when enabled.

props.name: variant
props.description: Specifies the input variant of the component.

props.name: size
props.description: Specifies the size of the component.

props.name: inputSize
props.description: Specifies the visible width of the input element in characters.

props.name: pattern
props.description: Specifies the value must match the pattern.

props.name: min
props.description: The value must be greater than or equal to the value.

props.name: max
props.description: The value must be less than or equal to the value.

props.name: step
props.description: Unless the step is set to the any literal, the value must be min + an integral multiple of the step.

props.name: minlength
props.description: The number of characters (code points) must not be less than the value of the attribute, if non-empty.

props.name: maxlength
props.description: The number of characters (code points) must not exceed the value of the attribute.

props.name: styleClass
props.description: Style class of the component.

props.name: inputStyle
props.description: Inline style of the input field.

props.name: inputId
props.description: Identifier of the focus input to match a label defined for the component.

props.name: inputStyleClass
props.description: Style class of the input field.

props.name: placeholder
props.description: Placeholder text for the input.

props.name: ariaLabelledBy
props.description: Establishes relationships between the component and label(s) where its value should be one or more element IDs.

props.name: ariaLabel
props.description: Defines a string that labels the input for accessibility.

props.name: iconAriaLabel
props.description: Defines a string that labels the icon button for accessibility.

props.name: dateFormat
props.description: Format of the date which can also be defined at locale settings.

props.name: multipleSeparator
props.description: Separator for multiple selection mode.

props.name: rangeSeparator
props.description: Separator for joining start and end dates on range selection mode.

props.name: inline
props.description: When enabled, displays the datepicker as inline. Default is false for popup mode.

props.name: showOtherMonths
props.description: Whether to display dates in other months (non-selectable) at the start or end of the current month. To make these days selectable use the selectOtherMonths option.

props.name: selectOtherMonths
props.description: Whether days in other months shown before or after the current month are selectable. This only applies if the showOtherMonths option is set to true.

props.name: showIcon
props.description: When enabled, displays a button with icon next to input.

props.name: icon
props.description: Icon of the datepicker button.

props.name: readonlyInput
props.description: When specified, prevents entering the date manually with keyboard.

props.name: shortYearCutoff
props.description: The cutoff year for determining the century for a date.

props.name: hourFormat
props.description: Specifies 12 or 24 hour format.

props.name: timeOnly
props.description: Whether to display timepicker only.

props.name: stepHour
props.description: Hours to change per step.

props.name: stepMinute
props.description: Minutes to change per step.

props.name: stepSecond
props.description: Seconds to change per step.

props.name: showSeconds
props.description: Whether to show the seconds in time picker.

props.name: showOnFocus
props.description: When disabled, datepicker will not be visible with input focus.

props.name: showWeek
props.description: When enabled, datepicker will show week numbers.

props.name: startWeekFromFirstDayOfYear
props.description: When enabled, datepicker will start week numbers from first day of the year.

props.name: showClear
props.description: When enabled, a clear icon is displayed to clear the value.

props.name: dataType
props.description: Type of the value to write back to ngModel, default is date and alternative is string.

props.name: selectionMode
props.description: Defines the quantity of the selection, valid values are "single", "multiple" and "range".

props.name: maxDateCount
props.description: Maximum number of selectable dates in multiple mode.

props.name: showButtonBar
props.description: Whether to display today and clear buttons at the footer

props.name: todayButtonStyleClass
props.description: Style class of the today button.

props.name: clearButtonStyleClass
props.description: Style class of the clear button.

props.name: autofocus
props.description: When present, it specifies that the component should automatically get focus on load.

props.name: autoZIndex
props.description: Whether to automatically manage layering.

props.name: baseZIndex
props.description: Base zIndex value to use in layering.

props.name: panelStyleClass
props.description: Style class of the datetimepicker container element.

props.name: panelStyle
props.description: Inline style of the datetimepicker container element.

props.name: keepInvalid
props.description: Keep invalid value when input blur.

props.name: hideOnDateTimeSelect
props.description: Whether to hide the overlay on date selection.

props.name: touchUI
props.description: When enabled, datepicker overlay is displayed as optimized for touch devices.

props.name: timeSeparator
props.description: Separator of time selector.

props.name: focusTrap
props.description: When enabled, can only focus on elements inside the datepicker.

props.name: showTransitionOptions
props.description: Transition options of the show animation.

props.name: hideTransitionOptions
props.description: Transition options of the hide animation.

props.name: tabindex
props.description: Index of the element in tabbing order.

props.name: minDate
props.description: The minimum selectable date.

props.name: maxDate
props.description: The maximum selectable date.

props.name: disabledDates
props.description: Array with dates that should be disabled (not selectable).

props.name: disabledDays
props.description: Array with weekday numbers that should be disabled (not selectable).

props.name: showTime
props.description: Whether to display timepicker.

props.name: responsiveOptions
props.description: An array of options for responsive design.

props.name: numberOfMonths
props.description: Number of months to display.

props.name: firstDayOfWeek
props.description: Defines the first of the week for various date calculations.

props.name: view
props.description: Type of view to display, valid values are "date" for datepicker and "month" for month picker.

props.name: defaultDate
props.description: Set the date to highlight on first opening if the field is blank.

props.name: appendTo
props.description: Target element to attach the overlay, valid values are "body" or a local ng-template variable of another element (note: use binding with brackets for template variables, e.g. [appendTo]="mydiv" for a div element having #mydiv as variable name).

props.name: motionOptions
props.description: The motion options.

templates.description: Custom template for disabled date cells.

templates.description: Custom template for previous month icon.

templates.name: nexticon
templates.description: Custom template for next month icon.

components.name: dialog
components.title: Angular Dialog Component
components.description: Dialog is a container to display content in an overlay window.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Dialog component uses dialog role along with aria-labelledby referring to the header element however any attribute is passed to the root element so you may use aria-labelledby to override this default behavior. In addition aria-modal is added since focus is kept within the popup. It is recommended to use a trigger component that can be accessed with keyboard such as a button, if not adding tabIndex would be necessary. Trigger element also requires aria-expanded and aria-controls to be handled explicitly. Close element is a button with an aria-label that refers to the aria.close property of the locale API by default, you may use closeButtonProps to customize the element and override the default aria-label . Maximize element is a button with an aria-label that refers to the aria.maximizeLabel and aria.minimizeLabel property of the locale API. It cannot be customized using the maximizeButtonProps . Overlay Keyboard Support Key Function tab Moves focus to the next the focusable element within the dialog. shift + tab Moves focus to the previous the focusable element within the dialog. escape Closes the dialog if closeOnEscape is true. Close Button Keyboard Support Key Function enter Closes the dialog. space Closes the dialog.

examples.html: Content

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Dialog is used as a container and visibility is controlled with visible property.

examples.basic: Update your information.
examples.html: Update your information.

sections.label: Headless
sections.description: Headless mode allows you to customize the entire user interface instead of the default elements.

examples.typescript:
import { Component } from '@angular/core'; import { ButtonModule } from 'primeng/button'; import { DialogModule } from 'primeng/dialog'; import { InputTextModule } from 'primeng/inputtext'; @Component({ template: `
`, standalone: true, imports: [ButtonModule, DialogModule, InputTextModule] }) export class DialogHeadlessDemo { visible: boolean = false; showDialog() { this.visible = true; } closeDialog() { this.visible = false; } }

sections.label: Long Content
sections.description: Dialog automatically displays a scroller when content exceeds viewport.

sections.label: overlaysinside-doc
sections.description: When dialog includes other components with overlays such as dropdown, the overlay part cannot exceed dialog boundaries due to overflow. In order to solve this, you can either append the overlay to the body by using appendTo property or allow overflow in dialog.

sections.label: Position
sections.description: The position property is used to display a Dialog at all edges and corners of the screen.

props.name: dt
props.description: Defines scoped design tokens of the component.

props.name: unstyled
props.description: Indicates whether the component should be rendered without styles.

props.name: pt
props.description: Used to pass attributes to DOM elements inside the component.

props.name: ptOptions
props.description: Used to configure passthrough(pt) options of the component.

props.name: header
props.description: Title text of the dialog.

props.name: draggable
props.description: Enables dragging to change the position using header.

props.name: resizable
props.description: Enables resizing of the content.

props.name: contentStyle
props.description: Style of the content section.

props.name: contentStyleClass
props.description: Style class of the content.

props.name: modal
props.description: Defines if background should be blocked when dialog is displayed.

props.name: closeOnEscape
props.description: Specifies if pressing escape key should hide the dialog.

props.name: dismissableMask
props.description: Specifies if clicking the modal background should hide the dialog.

props.name: rtl
props.description: When enabled dialog is displayed in RTL direction.

props.name: closable
props.description: Adds a close icon to the header to hide the dialog.

props.name: breakpoints
props.description: Object literal to define widths per screen size.

props.name: styleClass
props.description: Style class of the component.

props.name: maskStyleClass
props.description: Style class of the mask.

props.name: maskStyle
props.description: Style of the mask.

props.name: showHeader
props.description: Whether to show the header or not.

props.name: blockScroll
props.description: Whether background scroll should be blocked when dialog is visible.

props.name: autoZIndex
props.description: Whether to automatically manage layering.

props.name: baseZIndex
props.description: Base zIndex value to use in layering.

props.name: minX
props.description: Minimum value for the left coordinate of dialog in dragging.

props.name: minY
props.description: Minimum value for the top coordinate of dialog in dragging.

props.name: focusOnShow
props.description: When enabled, first focusable element receives focus on show.

props.name: maximizable
props.description: Whether the dialog can be displayed full screen.

props.name: keepInViewport
props.description: Keeps dialog in the viewport.

props.name: focusTrap
props.description: When enabled, can only focus on elements inside the dialog.

props.name: transitionOptions
props.description: Transition options of the animation.

props.name: maskMotionOptions
props.description: The motion options for the mask.

props.name: motionOptions
props.description: The motion options.

props.name: closeIcon
props.description: Name of the close icon.

props.name: closeAriaLabel
props.description: Defines a string that labels the close button for accessibility.

props.name: closeTabindex
props.description: Index of the close button in tabbing order.

props.name: minimizeIcon
props.description: Name of the minimize icon.

props.name: maximizeIcon
props.description: Name of the maximize icon.

props.name: closeButtonProps
props.description: Used to pass all properties of the ButtonProps to the Button component.

props.name: maximizeButtonProps
props.description: Used to pass all properties of the ButtonProps to the Button component.

props.name: visible
props.description: Specifies the visibility of the dialog.

props.name: style
props.description: Inline style of the component.

props.name: position
props.description: Position of the dialog.

props.name: appendTo
props.description: Target element to attach the overlay, valid values are "body" or a local ng-template variable of another element (note: use binding with brackets for template variables, e.g. [appendTo]="mydiv" for a div element having #mydiv as variable name).

emits.name: role
emits.description: Role attribute of html element.

emits.name: onShow
emits.description: Callback to invoke when dialog is shown.

emits.name: onHide
emits.description: Callback to invoke when dialog is hidden.

emits.name: visibleChange
emits.description: This EventEmitter is used to notify changes in the visibility state of a component.

emits.name: onResizeInit
emits.description: Callback to invoke when dialog resizing is initiated.

emits.name: onResizeEnd
emits.description: Callback to invoke when dialog resizing is completed.

emits.name: onDragEnd
emits.description: Callback to invoke when dialog dragging is completed.

emits.name: onMaximize
emits.description: Callback to invoke when dialog maximized or unmaximized.

pt.name: host
pt.description: Used to pass attributes to the host's DOM element.

pt.name: root
pt.description: Used to pass attributes to the root's DOM element.

pt.name: mask
pt.description: Used to pass attributes to the mask's DOM element.

pt.name: resizeHandle
pt.description: Used to pass attributes to the resize handle's DOM element.

pt.name: header
pt.description: Used to pass attributes to the header's DOM element.

pt.name: title
pt.description: Used to pass attributes to the title's DOM element.

pt.name: headerActions
pt.description: Used to pass attributes to the header actions' DOM element.

pt.name: pcMaximizeButton
pt.description: Used to pass attributes to the maximize Button component.

pt.name: pcCloseButton
pt.description: Used to pass attributes to the close Button component.

pt.name: content
pt.description: Used to pass attributes to the content's DOM element.

pt.name: footer
pt.description: Used to pass attributes to the footer's DOM element.

pt.name: motion
pt.description: Used to pass options to the motion component/directive.

styles.description: Class name of the mask element
Class name of the root element
Class name of the header element
Class name of the title element
Class name of the header actions element
Class name of the maximize button element
Class name of the close button element

components.name: divider
components.title: Angular Divider Component
components.description: Divider is used to separate contents.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Divider uses a separator role with aria-orientation set to either "horizontal" or "vertical". Keyboard Support Component does not include any interactive elements.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Divider is basically placed between the items to separate.

components.name: dock
components.title: Angular Dock Component
components.description: Dock is a navigation component consisting of menuitems.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Dock component uses the menu role with the aria-orientation and the value to describe the menu can either be provided with aria-labelledby or aria-label props. Each list item has a presentation role whereas anchor elements have a menuitem role with aria-label referring to the label of the item and aria-disabled defined if the item is disabled. Keyboard Support Key Function tab Add focus to the first item if focus moves in to the menu. If the focus is already within the menu, focus moves to the next focusable item in the page tab sequence. shift + tab Add focus to the last item if focus moves in to the menu. If the focus is already within the menu, focus moves to the previous focusable item in the page tab sequence. enter Activates the focused menuitem. space Activates the focused menuitem. down arrow Moves focus to the next menuitem in vertical layout. up arrow Moves focus to the previous menuitem in vertical layout. home Moves focus to the first menuitem in horizontal layout. end Moves focus to the last menuitem in horizontal layout.

sections.label: Advanced
sections.description: A mock desktop UI implemented with various components in addition to Dock.

examples.basic: Fri 13:07
examples.html: Fri 13:07

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Dock requires a collection of menuitems as its model . Default location is bottom and other sides are also available when defined with the position property. Content of the dock component is defined by item template.

components.name: dragdrop
components.title: Angular Drag and Drop Component
components.description: pDraggable and pDroppable directives apply drag-drop behaviors to any element.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: pDraggable and pDroppable are attached to a target element to add drag-drop behavior. The value of a Directive attribute is required and it defines the scope to match draggables with droppables. Droppable scope can also be an array to accept multiple droppables.

components.name: drawer
components.title: Angular Drawer Component
components.description: Drawer is a container component displayed as an overlay.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Drawer component uses complementary role by default, since any attribute is passed to the root element aria role can be changed depending on your use case and additional attributes like aria-labelledby can be added. In addition aria-modal is added since focus is kept within the drawer when opened. It is recommended to use a trigger component that can be accessed with keyboard such as a button, if not adding tabIndex would be necessary. Trigger element also requires aria-expanded and aria-controls to be handled explicitly. Overlay Keyboard Support Key Function tab Moves focus to the next the focusable element within the drawer. shift + tab Moves focus to the previous the focusable element within the drawer. escape Closes the dialog if closeOnEscape is true. Close Button Keyboard Support Key Function enter Closes the drawer. space Closes the drawer.

examples.html:
<p-button
    icon="pi pi-arrow-right"
    (click)="visible = true"
    aria-controls="{{visible ? 'drawer' : null}}"
    aria-expanded="{{visible ? true : false}}"
></p-button>
<p-drawer
    [(visible)]="visible"
    id="drawer"
    (onHide)="visible = false"
    role="region"
>
    content
</p-drawer>

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Drawer is used as a container and visibility is controlled with a binding to visible .

components.name: dynamicdialog
components.title: Angular Dynamic Dialog Component
components.description: Dialogs can be created dynamically with any component as the content using a DialogService.

sections.label: Closing a Dialog
sections.description: Most of the time, requirement is returning a value from the dialog. DialogRef's close method is used for this purpose where the parameter passed will be available at the onClose event at the caller. Here is an example on how to close the dialog from the ProductListDemo by passing a selected product.

sections.label: Customization
sections.description: DynamicDialog uses the Dialog component internally, visit dialog for more information about the available props.

sections.label: Example
sections.description: Dynamic dialogs require an instance of a DialogService that is responsible for displaying a dialog with a component as its content. Calling open method of DialogService will display dynamic dialog. First parameter of open method is the type of component to load and the second parameter is the configuration of the Dialog such as header , width and more.

examples.basic:
<p-toast />
<p-button (click)="show()" icon="pi pi-search" label="Select a Product" />

sections.label: Opening a Dialog
sections.description: The open method of the DialogService is used to open a Dialog. First parameter is the component to load and second one is the configuration object to customize the Dialog.

sections.label: Passing Data
sections.description: To pass data to a dynamically loaded component, you can use either the data or inputValues property, depending on your requirements. The data property is ideal for passing generic information that is not directly tied to the component's inputs, while inputValues allows you to set specific input properties on the component in a more structured and type-safe way. Both properties can be used together or independently, offering flexibility to meet different use cases. Additionally, the loaded component can control the dialog using the DynamicDialogRef API, providing complete control over the dialog lifecycle. Both DynamicDialogConfig and DynamicDialogRef are injectable through the constructor.

sections.label: style-doc
sections.description: Following is the list of structural style classes, for theming classes visit theming page.

sections.label: Usage
sections.description: To use dynamic dialog, a reference should be declared as DynamicDialogRef after the DialogService injected into the component.

components.name: editor
components.title: Angular Editor Component
components.description: Editor is rich text editor component based on Quill.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Quill performs generally well in terms of accessibility. The elements in the toolbar can be tabbed and have the necessary ARIA roles/attributes for screen readers. One known limitation is the lack of arrow key support for dropdowns in the toolbar that may be overcome with a custom toolbar.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: A model can be bound using the standard ngModel directive.

examples.basic: <p-editor [(ngModel)]="text" [style]="{ height: '320px' }" />

sections.label: customtoolbar-doc
sections.description: Editor provides a default toolbar with common options, to customize it define your elements inside the header element. Refer to Quill documentation for available controls.

sections.label: Quill
sections.description: Editor uses Quill editor underneath so it needs to be installed as a dependency.

sections.label: reactiveforms-doc
sections.description: Editor can also be used with reactive forms. In this case, the formControlName property is used to bind the component to a form control.

examples.basic: @if (isInvalid('text')) { Content is required. }
examples.html: @if (isInvalid('text')) { Content is required. }

sections.label: ReadOnly
sections.description: When readonly is present, the value cannot be edited.

examples.basic: <p-editor [(ngModel)]="text" [readonly]="true" [style]="{ height: '320px' }" />
@if (content.invalid && (content.touched || exampleForm.submitted)) { Content is required. }
examples.html: @if (content.invalid && (content.touched || exampleForm.submitted)) { Content is required. }

components.name: fieldset
components.title: Angular Fieldset Component
components.description: Fieldset is a grouping component with a content toggle feature.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Fieldset component uses the semantic fieldset element. When toggleable option is enabled, a clickable element with button role is included inside the legend element, this button has aria-controls to define the id of the content section along with aria-expanded for the visibility state. The value to read the button defaults to the value of the legend property and can be customized by defining an aria-label or aria-labelledby via the toggleButtonProps property. The content uses region , defines an id that matches the aria-controls of the content toggle button and aria-labelledby referring to the id of the header. Content Toggle Button Keyboard Support Key Function tab Moves focus to the next the focusable element in the page tab sequence. shift + tab Moves focus to the previous the focusable element in the page tab sequence. enter Toggles the visibility of the content. space Toggles the visibility of the content.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: A simple Fieldset is created with a legend property along with the content as children.

components.name: fileupload
components.title: Angular FileUpload Component
components.description: FileUpload is an advanced uploader with dragdrop support, multi file uploads, auto uploading, progress tracking and validations.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader FileUpload uses a hidden native input element with type="file" for screen readers. Keyboard Support Interactive elements of the uploader are buttons, visit the Button accessibility section for more information.

sections.label: Advanced
sections.description: Advanced uploader provides dragdrop support, multi file uploads, auto uploading, progress tracking and validations.

examples.basic: Drag and drop files to here to upload.
examples.html: Drag and drop files to here to upload.

sections.label: Auto
sections.description: When auto property is enabled, a file gets uploaded instantly after selection.

examples.basic:
<p-toast />
<p-fileupload mode="basic" name="demo[]" chooseIcon="pi pi-upload" url="https://www.primefaces.org/cdn/api/upload.php" accept="image/*" maxFileSize="1000000" (onUpload)="onBasicUploadAuto($event)" [auto]="true" chooseLabel="Browse" />

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: FileUpload basic mode provides a simpler UI as an alternative to default advanced mode.

examples.basic:
<p-fileupload #fu mode="basic" chooseLabel="Choose" chooseIcon="pi pi-upload" name="demo[]" url="https://www.primefaces.org/cdn/api/upload.php" accept="image/*" maxFileSize="1000000" (onUpload)="onUpload($event)" />
<p-button label="Upload" (onClick)="fu.upload()" severity="secondary" />

sections.label: custom-doc
sections.description: FileUpload basic mode provides a simpler UI as an alternative to default advanced mode.

examples.basic:
<p-toast></p-toast>
<p-fileupload name="myfile[]" [customUpload]="true" (uploadHandler)="customUploader($event)"></p-fileupload>

Uploader UI is customizable using a ng-template called file that gets the File instance as the implicit variable. Second ng-template named content can be used to place custom content inside the content section which would be useful to implement a user interface to manage the uploaded files such as removing them. This template gets the selected files as the implicit variable. Third and final ng-template option is toolbar to display custom content at toolbar.

components.name: floatlabel
components.title: Angular Float Label Component
components.description: FloatLabel appears on top of the input field when focused.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader FloatLabel does not require any roles and attributes. Keyboard Support Component does not include any interactive elements.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: FloatLabel is used by wrapping the input and its label.

examples.basic:
<p-floatlabel>
    <input id="username" pInputText [(ngModel)]="value" autocomplete="off" />
    <label for="username">Username</label>
</p-floatlabel>

sections.label: Invalid
sections.description: When the form element is invalid, the label is also highlighted.

examples.basic:
<p-floatlabel>
    <input pInputText id="value1" [(ngModel)]="value1" [invalid]="!value1" autocomplete="off" />
    <label for="value1">Username</label>
</p-floatlabel>
<p-floatlabel variant="in">
    <input pInputText id="value2" [(ngModel)]="value2" [invalid]="!value2" autocomplete="off" />
    <label for="value2">Username</label>
</p-floatlabel>
<p-floatlabel variant="on">
    <input pInputText id="value3" [(ngModel)]="value3" [invalid]="!value3" autocomplete="off" />
    <label for="value3">Username</label>
</p-floatlabel>

sections.label: Variants
sections.description: The variant property defines the position of the label. Default value is over , whereas in and on are the alternatives.

examples.basic:
<p-floatlabel variant="in">
    <input pInputText id="in_label" [(ngModel)]="value1" autocomplete="off" />
    <label for="in_label">In Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>
<p-floatlabel variant="on">
    <input pInputText id="on_label" [(ngModel)]="value2" autocomplete="off" />
    <label for="on_label">On Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>

Enabling the fluid for each component individually may be cumbersome so wrap the content with Fluid to instead for an easier alternative. Any component that has the fluid property can be nested inside the Fluid component. The fluid property of a child component has higher precedence than the fluid container as shown in the last sample.

components.name: galleria
components.title: Angular Gallery Component
components.description: Galleria is an advanced content gallery component.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Galleria uses region role and since any attribute is passed to the main container element, attributes such as aria-label and aria-roledescription can be used as well. The slides container has aria-live attribute set as "polite" if galleria is not in autoplay mode, otherwise "off" would be the value in autoplay. A slide has a group role with an aria-label that refers to the aria.slideNumber property of the locale API. Similarly aria.slide is used as the aria-roledescription of the item. Inactive slides are hidden from the readers with aria-hidden . Next and Previous navigators are button elements with aria-label attributes referring to the aria.nextPageLabel and aria.firstPageLabel properties of the locale API by default respectively, you may still use your own aria roles and attributes as any valid attribute is passed to the button elements implicitly by using nextButtonProps and prevButtonProps . Quick navigation elements and thumnbails follow the tab pattern. They are placed inside an element with a tablist role whereas each item has a tab role with aria-selected and aria-controls attributes. The aria-label attribute of a quick navigation item refers to the aria.pageLabel of the locale API. Current page is marked with aria-current . In full screen mode, modal element uses dialog role with aria-modal enabled. The close button retrieves aria-label from the aria.close property of the locale API. Next/Prev Keyboard Support Key Function tab Moves focus through interactive elements in the carousel. enter Activates navigation. space Activates navigation. Quick Navigation Keyboard Support Key Function tab Moves focus through the active slide link. enter Activates the focused slide link. space Activates the focused slide link. right arrow Moves focus to the next slide link. left arrow Moves focus to the previous slide link. home Moves focus to the first slide link. end Moves focus to the last slide link.

sections.label: Advanced
sections.description: Galleria can be extended further to implement complex requirements.

components.name: iconfield
components.title: Angular IconField Component
components.description: IconField wraps an input and an icon.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader IconField and InputIcon does not require any roles and attributes. Keyboard Support Components does not include any interactive elements.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: A group is created by wrapping the input and icon with the IconField component. Each icon is defined as a child of InputIcon component. In addition, position of the icon can be changed using iconPosition property that the default value is right and also left option is available.

examples.basic:
<p-iconfield>
    <p-inputicon class="pi pi-search" />
    <input type="text" pInputText placeholder="Search" />
</p-iconfield>
<p-iconfield>
    <input type="text" pInputText />
    <p-inputicon class="pi pi-spinner pi-spin" />
</p-iconfield>

sections.label: Float Label
sections.description: FloatLabel visually integrates a label with its form element. Visit FloatLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<p-floatlabel>
    <p-iconfield>
        <p-inputicon class="pi pi-search" />
        <input pInputText id="over_label" [(ngModel)]="value1" autocomplete="off" />
    </p-iconfield>
    <label for="over_label">Over Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>
<p-floatlabel variant="in">
    <p-iconfield>
        <p-inputicon class="pi pi-search" />
        <input pInputText id="in_label" [(ngModel)]="value2" autocomplete="off" />
    </p-iconfield>
    <label for="in_label">In Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>
<p-floatlabel variant="on">
    <p-iconfield>
        <p-inputicon class="pi pi-search" />
        <input pInputText id="on_label" [(ngModel)]="value3" autocomplete="off" />
    </p-iconfield>
    <label for="on_label">On Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>

sections.label: Ifta Label
sections.description: IftaLabel is used to create infield top aligned labels. Visit IftaLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<p-iftalabel>
    <p-iconfield>
        <p-inputicon class="pi pi-user" />
        <input pInputText id="username" [(ngModel)]="value" autocomplete="off" />
    </p-iconfield>
    <label for="username">Username</label>
</p-iftalabel>

sections.label: Sizes
sections.description: IconField is compatible with the pSize setting of the input field.

examples.basic:
<p-iconfield>
    <p-inputicon class="pi pi-search" />
    <input pInputText [(ngModel)]="value1" placeholder="Small" pSize="small" />
</p-iconfield>
<p-iconfield>
    <input pInputText [(ngModel)]="value2" placeholder="Normal" />
    <p-inputicon class="pi pi-user" />
</p-iconfield>
<p-iconfield>
    <p-inputicon class="pi pi-lock" />
    <input pInputText [(ngModel)]="value3" placeholder="Large" pSize="large" />
    <p-inputicon class="pi pi-spin pi-spinner" />
</p-iconfield>

sections.label: Template
sections.description: An eye icon is displayed by default when the image is hovered in preview mode. Use the indicator template for custom content.

examples.typescript:
import { Component } from '@angular/core'; import { IconFieldModule } from 'primeng/iconfield'; import { InputIconModule } from 'primeng/inputicon'; import { InputTextModule } from 'primeng/inputtext'; @Component({ template: `
`, standalone: true, imports: [IconFieldModule, InputIconModule, InputTextModule] }) export class IconfieldTemplateDemo {}

components.name: inplace
components.title: Angular Inplace Component
components.description: Inplace provides an easy to do editing and display at the same time where clicking the output displays the actual content.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Inplace component defines aria-live as "polite" by default, since any valid attribute is passed to the main container aria roles and attributes of the root element can be customized easily. Display element uses button role in view mode by default, displayProps can be used for customizations like adding aria-label or aria-labelledby attributes to describe the content of the view mode or even overriding the default role. Closable inplace components displays a button with an aria-label that refers to the aria.close property of the locale API by default, you may use closeButtonProps to customize the element and override the default aria-label . View Mode Keyboard Support Key Function enter Switches to content. Close Button Keyboard Support Key Function enter Switches to display. space Switches to display.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Inplace component requires display and content templates to define the content of each state.

components.name: inputgroup
components.title: Angular InputGroup Component
components.description: Text, icon, buttons and other content can be grouped next to an input.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader InputGroup and InputGroupAddon does not require any roles and attributes. Keyboard Support Component does not include any interactive elements.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: A group is created by wrapping the input and add-ons with the p-inputgroup component. Each add-on element is defined as a child of p-inputgroup-addon component.

examples.basic: $ .00 www
examples.html: $ .00 www

sections.label: Button
sections.description: Buttons can be placed at either side of an input element.

examples.basic:
<p-inputgroup>
    <p-button label="Search" />
    <input pInputText placeholder="Keyword" />
</p-inputgroup>
<p-inputgroup>
    <input pInputText placeholder="Keyword" />
    <p-inputgroup-addon>
        <p-button icon="pi pi-search" severity="secondary" variant="text" (click)="menu.toggle($event)" />
    </p-inputgroup-addon>
</p-inputgroup>
<p-menu #menu [model]="items" popup styleClass="!min-w-fit" />
<p-inputgroup>
    <p-inputgroup-addon>
        <p-button icon="pi pi-check" severity="secondary" />
    </p-inputgroup-addon>
    <input pInputText placeholder="Vote" />
    <p-inputgroup-addon>
        <p-button icon="pi pi-times" severity="secondary" />
    </p-inputgroup-addon>
</p-inputgroup>

sections.label: Checkbox & Radio
sections.description: Checkbox and RadioButton components can be combined with an input element under the same group.

examples.basic:
<p-inputgroup>
    <input type="text" pInputText placeholder="Price" />
    <p-inputgroup-addon><p-radiobutton [(ngModel)]="radioValue1" name="rb1" value="rb1" /></p-inputgroup-addon>
</p-inputgroup>
<p-inputgroup>
    <p-inputgroup-addon><p-checkbox [(ngModel)]="checked1" [binary]="true" /></p-inputgroup-addon>
    <input type="text" pInputText placeholder="Username" />
</p-inputgroup>
<p-inputgroup>
    <p-inputgroup-addon><p-checkbox [(ngModel)]="checked2" [binary]="true" /></p-inputgroup-addon>
    <input type="text" pInputText placeholder="Website" />
    <p-inputgroup-addon><p-radiobutton name="rb2" value="rb2" [(ngModel)]="category" /></p-inputgroup-addon>
</p-inputgroup>

sections.label: Float Label
sections.description: FloatLabel visually integrates a label with its form element. Visit FloatLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic: $ .00 www
examples.html: $ .00 www

sections.description: IftaLabel is used to create infield top aligned labels. Visit IftaLabel documentation for more information.

sections.label: Multiple
sections.description: Multiple add-ons can be placed inside the same group.

components.name: inputmask
components.title: Angular InputMask Component
components.description: InputMask component is used to enter input in a certain format such as numeric, date, currency and phone.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader InputMask component renders a native input element that implicitly includes any passed prop. Value to describe the component can either be provided via label tag combined with id prop or using ariaLabelledBy , ariaLabel props.

examples.basic: Phone

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: InputMask is used as a controlled input with ngModel properties.

examples.basic: <p-inputmask mask="99-999999" [(ngModel)]="value" placeholder="99-999999" />

sections.label: Clear Icon
sections.description: When showClear is enabled, a clear icon is displayed to clear the value.

examples.basic: <p-inputmask mask="99-999999" [(ngModel)]="value" placeholder="99-999999" [showClear]="true" />

sections.label: Disabled
sections.description: When disabled is present, the element cannot be edited and focused.

examples.basic: <p-inputmask mask="999-99-9999" [(ngModel)]="value" [disabled]="true" />

sections.label: Filled
sections.description: Specify the variant property as filled to display the component with a higher visual emphasis than the default outlined style.

examples.basic: <p-inputmask mask="99-999999" [(ngModel)]="value" variant="filled" placeholder="99-999999" />

sections.label: Float Label
sections.description: FloatLabel visually integrates a label with its form element. Visit FloatLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<p-floatlabel>
    <p-inputmask id="over_label" [(ngModel)]="value1" mask="999-99-9999" />
    <label for="over_label">Over Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>
<p-floatlabel variant="in">
    <p-inputmask id="in_label" [(ngModel)]="value2" mask="999-99-9999" />
    <label for="in_label">In Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>
<p-floatlabel variant="on">
    <p-inputmask id="on_label" [(ngModel)]="value3" mask="999-99-9999" />
    <label for="on_label">On Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>

sections.label: Fluid
sections.description: The fluid prop makes the component take up the full width of its container when set to true.

examples.basic: <p-inputmask mask="99-999999" [(ngModel)]="value" placeholder="99-999999" fluid />

sections.label: Ifta Label
sections.description: IftaLabel is used to create infield top aligned labels. Visit IftaLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<p-iftalabel>
    <p-inputmask id="ssn" [(ngModel)]="value" mask="999-99-9999" autocomplete="off" />
    <label for="ssn">SSN</label>
</p-iftalabel>

sections.label: Invalid
sections.description: The invalid state is applied using the invalid property to indicate failed validation, which can be integrated with Angular Forms.

examples.basic:
<p-inputmask [(ngModel)]="value1" mask="99-999999" placeholder="Serial Key" [invalid]="!value1" />
<p-inputmask [(ngModel)]="value2" mask="99-999999" placeholder="Serial Key" [invalid]="!value2" variant="filled" />

sections.label: Mask
sections.description: Mask format can be a combination of the following definitions; a for alphabetic characters, 9 for numeric characters and * for alphanumberic characters. In addition, formatting characters like ( , ) , - are also accepted.

examples.basic:
SSN
Phone
Serial Number
examples.html:
SSN
Phone
Serial Number

sections.label: Optional
sections.description: When the input does not complete the mask definition, it is cleared by default. Use autoClear property to control this behavior. In addition, ? is used to mark anything after the question mark optional.

examples.basic: <p-inputmask mask="(999) 999-9999? x99999" [(ngModel)]="value" placeholder="(999) 999-9999? x99999" />

sections.label: reactiveforms-doc
sections.description: InputMask can also be used with reactive forms. In this case, the formControlName property is used to bind the component to a form control.

examples.basic: @if (isInvalid('value')) { Serial number is required. }
examples.html: @if (isInvalid('value')) { Serial number is required. }

sections.label: Sizes
sections.description: InputMask provides small and large sizes as alternatives to the base.

examples.basic:
<p-inputmask [(ngModel)]="value1" placeholder="Small" size="small" mask="99-999999" />
<p-inputmask [(ngModel)]="value2" placeholder="Normal" mask="99-999999" />
<p-inputmask [(ngModel)]="value3" placeholder="Large" size="large" mask="99-999999" />

sections.label: SlotChar
sections.description: Default placeholder for a mask is underscore that can be customized using slotChar property.

examples.basic: <p-inputmask [(ngModel)]="value" mask="99/99/9999" placeholder="99/99/9999" slotChar="mm/dd/yyyy" />
@if (serialNumber.invalid && (serialNumber.touched || exampleForm.submitted)) { Serial number is required. }
examples.html: @if (serialNumber.invalid && (serialNumber.touched || exampleForm.submitted)) { Serial number is required. }

props.name: dt
props.description: Defines scoped design tokens of the component.

props.name: unstyled
props.description: Indicates whether the component should be rendered without styles.

props.name: pt
props.description: Used to pass attributes to DOM elements inside the component.

props.name: ptOptions
props.description: Used to configure passthrough(pt) options of the component.

props.name: required
props.description: There must be a value (if set).

props.name: invalid
props.description: When present, it specifies that the component should have invalid state style.

props.name: disabled
props.description: When present, it specifies that the component should have disabled state style.

props.name: name
props.description: When present, it specifies that the name of the input.

props.name: fluid
props.description: Spans 100% width of the container when enabled.

props.name: variant
props.description: Specifies the input variant of the component.

props.name: size
props.description: Specifies the size of the component.

props.name: inputSize
props.description: Specifies the visible width of the input element in characters.

props.name: pattern
props.description: Specifies the value must match the pattern.

props.name: min
props.description: The value must be greater than or equal to the value.

props.name: max
props.description: The value must be less than or equal to the value.

props.name: step
props.description: Unless the step is set to the any literal, the value must be min + an integral multiple of the step.

props.name: minlength
props.description: The number of characters (code points) must not be less than the value of the attribute, if non-empty.

props.name: maxlength
props.description: The number of characters (code points) must not exceed the value of the attribute.

props.name: type
props.description: HTML5 input type.

props.name: slotChar
props.description: Placeholder character in mask, default is underscore.

props.name: autoClear
props.description: Clears the incomplete value on blur.

props.name: showClear
props.description: When enabled, a clear icon is displayed to clear the value.

props.name: style

props.name: inputId
props.description: Identifier of the focus input to match a label defined for the component.

props.name: styleClass
props.description: Style class of the input field.

props.name: placeholder
props.description: Advisory information to display on input.

props.name: tabindex
props.description: Specifies tab order of the element.

props.name: title
props.description: Title text of the input text.

props.name: ariaLabel
props.description: Used to define a string that labels the input element.

props.name: ariaLabelledBy
props.description: Establishes relationships between the component and label(s) where its value should be one or more element IDs.

props.name: ariaRequired
props.description: Used to indicate that user input is required on an element before a form can be submitted.

props.name: readonly
props.description: When present, it specifies that an input field is read-only.

props.name: unmask
props.description: Defines if ngModel sets the raw unmasked value to bound value or the formatted mask value.

props.name: characterPattern
props.description: Regex pattern for alpha characters

props.name: autofocus
props.description: When present, the input gets a focus automatically on load.

props.name: autocomplete
props.description: Used to define a string that autocomplete attribute the current element.

props.name: keepBuffer
props.description: When present, it specifies that whether to clean buffer value from model.

props.name: mask
props.description: Mask pattern.

emits.description: Callback to invoke when the mask is completed.

emits.name: onFocus

emits.description: Callback to invoke when the component loses focus.

emits.name: onInput
emits.description: Callback to invoke on input.

emits.name: onKeydown
emits.description: Callback to invoke on input key press.

emits.name: onClear
emits.description: Callback to invoke when input field is cleared.

components.name: inputnumber
components.title: Angular InputNumber Component
components.description: InputNumber is an input component to provide numerical input.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Value to describe the component can either be provided via label tag combined with inputId prop or using ariaLabelledBy , ariaLabel , ariaDescribedBy props. The input element uses spinbutton role in addition to the aria-valuemin , aria-valuemax and aria-valuenow attributes.

examples.basic: Number Information

sections.label: Buttons
sections.description: Spinner buttons are enabled using the showButtons options and layout is defined with the buttonLayout . Default value is "stacked" whereas "horizontal" and "stacked" are alternatives. Note that even there are no buttons, up and down arrow keys can be used to spin the values with keyboard.

sections.label: Clear Icon
sections.description: When showClear is enabled, a clear icon is displayed to clear the value.

examples.basic: <p-inputnumber [(ngModel)]="value" inputId="price_input" mode="currency" currency="USD" locale="en-US" [showClear]="true" inputStyleClass="w-56" />

sections.label: Currency
sections.description: Currency formatting is specified by setting the mode option to currency and currency property. In addition currencyDisplay option allows how the currency is displayed, valid values are "symbol" (default) or "code".

sections.label: Disabled
sections.description: When disabled is present, the element cannot be edited and focused.

examples.basic: <p-inputnumber inputId="integeronly" [disabled]="true" prefix="%" [(ngModel)]="value1" />

sections.label: Filled
sections.description: Specify the variant property as filled to display the component with a higher visual emphasis than the default outlined style.

examples.basic: <p-inputnumber variant="filled" [(ngModel)]="value1" />

sections.label: Float Label
sections.description: A floating label appears on top of the input field when focused. Visit FloatLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<p-floatlabel>
    <p-inputnumber [(ngModel)]="value1" inputId="over_label" mode="currency" currency="USD" locale="en-US" />
    <label for="over_label">Over Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>
<p-floatlabel variant="in">
    <p-inputnumber [(ngModel)]="value2" inputId="in_label" mode="currency" currency="USD" locale="en-US" />
    <label for="in_label">In Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>
<p-floatlabel variant="on">
    <p-inputnumber [(ngModel)]="value3" inputId="on_label" mode="currency" currency="USD" locale="en-US" />
    <label for="on_label">On Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>

sections.label: Fluid
sections.description: The fluid prop makes the component take up the full width of its container when set to true.

examples.basic: <p-inputnumber [(ngModel)]="value" inputId="price_input" mode="currency" currency="USD" locale="en-US" fluid />

sections.label: Ifta Label
sections.description: IftaLabel is used to create infield top aligned labels. Visit IftaLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<p-iftalabel>
    <p-inputnumber [(ngModel)]="value" inputId="price_input" mode="currency" currency="USD" locale="en-US" />
    <label for="price_input">Price</label>
</p-iftalabel>

sections.label: Invalid
sections.description: The invalid state is applied using the invalid property to indicate failed validation, which can be integrated with Angular Forms.

examples.basic:
<p-inputnumber [(ngModel)]="value1" [invalid]="value1 === undefined" mode="decimal" [minFractionDigits]="2" placeholder="Amount" />
<p-inputnumber [(ngModel)]="value2" [invalid]="value2 === undefined" mode="decimal" [minFractionDigits]="2" variant="filled" placeholder="Amount" />

sections.label: Locale
sections.description: Localization information such as grouping and decimal symbols are defined with the locale property which defaults to the user locale.

sections.label: Numerals
sections.description: InputNumber is used as a controlled input with ngModel property.

sections.label: Prefix & Suffix
sections.description: Custom texts e.g. units can be placed before or after the input section with the prefix and suffix properties.

sections.label: reactiveforms-doc
sections.description: InputNumber can also be used with reactive forms. In this case, the formControlName property is used to bind the component to a form control.

examples.basic: @if (isInvalid('value')) { Number is required. }
examples.html: @if (isInvalid('value')) { Number is required. }

sections.label: Sizes
sections.description: InputNumber provides small and large sizes as alternatives to the base.

examples.basic:
<p-inputnumber [(ngModel)]="value1" size="small" placeholder="Small" mode="currency" currency="USD" locale="en-US" />
<p-inputnumber [(ngModel)]="value2" placeholder="Normal" mode="currency" currency="USD" locale="en-US" />
<p-inputnumber [(ngModel)]="value3" size="large" placeholder="Large" mode="currency" currency="USD" locale="en-US" />
@if (inputValue.invalid && (inputValue.touched || exampleForm.submitted)) { Number is required. }
examples.html: @if (inputValue.invalid && (inputValue.touched || exampleForm.submitted)) { Number is required. }

sections.label: Vertical
sections.description: Buttons can also placed vertically by setting buttonLayout as vertical .

props.description: Defines scoped design tokens of the component.

props.description: Indicates whether the component should be rendered without styles.

props.name: pt
props.description: Used to pass attributes to DOM elements inside the component.

props.name: ptOptions
props.description: Used to configure passthrough(pt) options of the component.

props.name: required
props.description: There must be a value (if set).

props.name: invalid
props.description: When present, it specifies that the component should have invalid state style.

props.name: disabled
props.description: When present, it specifies that the component should have disabled state style.

props.name: name
props.description: When present, it specifies that the name of the input.

props.name: fluid
props.description: Spans 100% width of the container when enabled.

props.name: variant
props.description: Specifies the input variant of the component.

props.name: size
props.description: Specifies the size of the component.

props.name: inputSize
props.description: Specifies the visible width of the input element in characters.

props.name: pattern
props.description: Specifies the value must match the pattern.

props.name: min
props.description: The value must be greater than or equal to the value.

props.name: max
props.description: The value must be less than or equal to the value.

props.name: step
props.description: Unless the step is set to the any literal, the value must be min + an integral multiple of the step.

props.name: minlength
props.description: The number of characters (code points) must not be less than the value of the attribute, if non-empty.

props.name: maxlength
props.description: The number of characters (code points) must not exceed the value of the attribute.

props.name: showButtons
props.description: Displays spinner buttons.

props.name: format
props.description: Whether to format the value.

props.name: buttonLayout
props.description: Layout of the buttons, valid values are "stacked" (default), "horizontal" and "vertical".

props.name: inputId
props.description: Identifier of the focus input to match a label defined for the component.

props.name: styleClass
props.description: Style class of the component.

props.name: placeholder
props.description: Advisory information to display on input.

props.name: tabindex
props.description: Specifies tab order of the element.

props.name: title
props.description: Title text of the input text.

props.name: ariaLabelledBy
props.description: Specifies one or more IDs in the DOM that labels the input field.

props.name: ariaDescribedBy
props.description: Specifies one or more IDs in the DOM that describes the input field.

props.name: ariaLabel
props.description: Used to define a string that labels the input element.

props.name: ariaRequired
props.description: Used to indicate that user input is required on an element before a form can be submitted.

props.name: autocomplete
props.description: Used to define a string that autocomplete attribute the current element.

props.name: incrementButtonClass
props.description: Style class of the increment button.

props.name: decrementButtonClass
props.description: Style class of the decrement button.

props.name: incrementButtonIcon
props.description: Style class of the increment button.

props.name: decrementButtonIcon
props.description: Style class of the decrement button.

props.name: readonly
props.description: When present, it specifies that an input field is read-only.

props.name: allowEmpty
props.description: Determines whether the input field is empty.

props.name: locale
props.description: Locale to be used in formatting.

props.name: localeMatcher
props.description: The locale matching algorithm to use. Possible values are "lookup" and "best fit"; the default is "best fit". See Locale Negotiation for details.

props.name: mode
props.description: Defines the behavior of the component, valid values are "decimal" and "currency".

props.name: currency
props.description: The currency to use in currency formatting. Possible values are the ISO 4217 currency codes, such as "USD" for the US dollar, "EUR" for the euro, or "CNY" for the Chinese RMB. There is no default value; if the style is "currency", the currency property must be provided.

props.name: currencyDisplay
props.description: How to display the currency in currency formatting. Possible values are "symbol" to use a localized currency symbol such as , "code" to use the ISO currency code, "name" to use a localized currency name such as "dollar"; the default is "symbol".

props.name: useGrouping
props.description: Whether to use grouping separators, such as thousands separators or thousand/lakh/crore separators.

props.name: minFractionDigits
props.description: The minimum number of fraction digits to use. Possible values are from 0 to 20; the default for plain number and percent formatting is 0; the default for currency formatting is the number of minor unit digits provided by the ISO 4217 currency code list (2 if the list doesn't provide that information).

props.name: maxFractionDigits
props.description: The maximum number of fraction digits to use. Possible values are from 0 to 20; the default for plain number formatting is the larger of minimumFractionDigits and 3; the default for currency formatting is the larger of minimumFractionDigits and the number of minor unit digits provided by the ISO 4217 currency code list (2 if the list doesn't provide that information).

props.name: prefix
props.description: Text to display before the value.

props.name: suffix
props.description: Text to display after the value.

props.name: inputStyle
props.description: Inline style of the input field.

props.name: inputStyleClass
props.description: Style class of the input field.

props.name: showClear
props.description: When enabled, a clear icon is displayed to clear the value.

props.name: autofocus
props.description: When present, it specifies that the component should automatically get focus on load.

emits.name: onInput
emits.description: Callback to invoke on input.

emits.name: onFocus
emits.description: Callback to invoke when the component receives focus.

emits.name: onBlur
emits.description: Callback to invoke when the component loses focus.

emits.name: onKeyDown
emits.description: Callback to invoke on input key press.

emits.name: onClear
emits.description: Callback to invoke when clear token is clicked.

components.name: inputotp
components.title: Angular Otp Input Component
components.description: Input Otp is used to enter one time passwords.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Input OTP uses a set of InputText components, refer to the InputText component for more information about the screen reader support.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Two-way value binding is defined using ngModel . The number of characters is defined with the length property, which is set to 4 by default.

examples.basic: <p-inputotp [(ngModel)]="value" />

sections.label: Integer Only
sections.description: When integerOnly is present, only integers can be accepted as input.

examples.basic: <p-inputotp [(ngModel)]="value" [integerOnly]="true" />

sections.label: Mask
sections.description: Enable the mask option to hide the values in the input fields.

examples.basic: <p-inputotp [(ngModel)]="value" [mask]="true" />

sections.label: reactiveforms-doc
sections.description: InputOtp can also be used with reactive forms. In this case, the formControlName property is used to bind the component to a form control.

examples.basic: @if (isInvalid('value')) { Passcode is required. }
examples.html: @if (isInvalid('value')) { Passcode is required. }

sections.label: Sample
sections.description: A sample UI implementation with templating and additional elements.

examples.basic:
Authenticate Your Account

Please enter the code sent to your phone.
examples.html:
Authenticate Your Account

Please enter the code sent to your phone.

sections.label: Sizes
sections.description: InputOtp provides small and large sizes as alternatives to the base.

examples.basic:
<p-inputotp [(ngModel)]="value1" size="small" />
<p-inputotp [(ngModel)]="value2" />
<p-inputotp [(ngModel)]="value3" size="large" />

sections.label: Template
sections.description: Define a template with your own UI elements with bindings to the provided events and attributes to replace the default design.

examples.basic:
<p-inputotp [(ngModel)]="value">
    <ng-template #input let-token let-events="events">
        <input class="custom-otp-input" (keydown)="events.keydown($event)" (input)="events.input($event)" type="text" [attr.value]="token" [maxLength]="1" />
    </ng-template>
</p-inputotp>
@if (otpModel.invalid && (otpModel.touched || exampleForm.submitted)) { Passcode is required. }
examples.html: @if (otpModel.invalid && (otpModel.touched || exampleForm.submitted)) { Passcode is required. }

components.name: inputtext
components.title: Angular InputText Component
components.description: InputText is an extension to standard input element with theming and keyfiltering.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader InputText component renders a native input element that implicitly includes any passed prop. Value to describe the component can either be provided via label tag combined with id prop or using aria-labelledby , aria-label props.

examples.basic: Lastname

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: InputText is used as a controlled input with ngModel property.

examples.basic: <input type="text" pInputText [(ngModel)]="value" />

sections.label: Disabled
sections.description: When disabled is present, the element cannot be edited and focused.

examples.basic: <input pInputText [disabled]="true" [(ngModel)]="value" />

sections.label: Filled
sections.description: Specify the variant property as filled to display the component with a higher visual emphasis than the default outlined style.

examples.basic: <input type="text" pInputText [(ngModel)]="value" variant="filled" />

sections.label: Float Label
sections.description: FloatLabel visually integrates a label with its form element. Visit FloatLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<p-floatlabel>
    <input pInputText id="over_label" [(ngModel)]="value1" autocomplete="off" />
    <label for="over_label">Over Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>
<p-floatlabel variant="in">
    <input pInputText id="in_label" [(ngModel)]="value2" autocomplete="off" />
    <label for="in_label">In Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>
<p-floatlabel variant="on">
    <input pInputText id="on_label" [(ngModel)]="value3" autocomplete="off" />
    <label for="on_label">On Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>

sections.label: Fluid
sections.description: The fluid prop makes the component take up the full width of its container when set to true.

examples.basic: <input type="text" pInputText [(ngModel)]="value" fluid />

sections.label: Help Text
sections.description: An advisory text can be defined with the semantic small tag.

examples.basic: Enter your username to reset your password.
examples.html: Enter your username to reset your password.

sections.label: icons-doc
sections.description: Icons can be placed inside an input element by wrapping both the input and the icon with an element that has either .p-input-icon-left or p-input-icon-right class.

sections.label: Ifta Label
sections.description: IftaLabel is used to create infield top aligned labels. Visit IftaLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<p-iftalabel>
    <input pInputText id="username" [(ngModel)]="value" autocomplete="off" />
    <label for="username">Username</label>
</p-iftalabel>

sections.label: Invalid
sections.description: The invalid state is applied using the invalid property to indicate failed validation, which can be integrated with Angular Forms.

examples.basic:
<input pInputText [(ngModel)]="value1" [invalid]="!value1" placeholder="Name" />
<input pInputText [(ngModel)]="value2" [invalid]="!value2" variant="filled" placeholder="Name" />

sections.label: keyfilter-doc
sections.description: InputText has built-in key filtering support to block certain keys, refer to keyfilter page for more information.

examples.basic: <input pInputText pKeyFilter="int" placeholder="Integers" [(ngModel)]="value" />

@if (isInvalid('username')) { Username is required. }
@if (isInvalid('email')) { @if (exampleForm.get('email')?.errors?.['required']) { Email is required. } @if (exampleForm.get('email')?.errors?.['email']) { Please enter a valid email. } }
examples.html:
@if (isInvalid('username')) { Username is required. }
@if (isInvalid('email')) { @if (exampleForm.get('email')?.errors?.['required']) { Email is required. } @if (exampleForm.get('email')?.errors?.['email']) { Please enter a valid email. } }

sections.label: Sizes
sections.description: InputText provides small and large sizes as alternatives to the standard.

examples.basic:
<input pInputText [(ngModel)]="value1" type="text" pSize="small" placeholder="Small" />
<input pInputText [(ngModel)]="value2" type="text" placeholder="Normal" />
<input pInputText [(ngModel)]="value3" type="text" pSize="large" placeholder="Large" />

@if (username.invalid && (username.touched || exampleForm.submitted)) { Username is required. }
@if (email.invalid && (email.touched || exampleForm.submitted)) { @if (email.hasError('required')) { Email is Required. } @if (email.hasError('email')) { Please enter a valid email. } }
examples.html:
@if (username.invalid && (username.touched || exampleForm.submitted)) { Username is required. }
@if (email.invalid && (email.touched || exampleForm.submitted)) { @if (email.hasError('required')) { Email is Required. } @if (email.hasError('email')) { Please enter a valid email. } }

components.name: keyfilter
components.title: Angular KeyFilter Component
components.description: KeyFilter is a directive to restrict individual key strokes. In order to restrict the whole input, use InputNumber or InputMask instead.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Refer to InputText for accessibility as KeyFilter is a built-in add-on of the InputText.

sections.label: Presets
sections.description: KeyFilter provides various presets configured with the pKeyFilter property.

examples.typescript:
import { Component } from '@angular/core'; import { InputTextModule } from 'primeng/inputtext'; @Component({ template: `
`, standalone: true, imports: [InputTextModule] }) export class KeyfilterPresetsDemo {}

sections.label: Regex
sections.description: In addition to the presets, a regular expression can be configured for customization.

props.name: pValidateOnly
props.description: When enabled, instead of blocking keys, input is validated internally to test against the regular expression.

props.name: pattern
props.description: Sets the pattern for key filtering.

emits.name: ngModelChange
emits.description: Emits a value whenever the ngModel of the component changes.

components.name: knob
components.title: Angular Knob Component
components.description: Knob is a form component to define number inputs with a dial.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Knob element component uses slider role in addition to the aria-valuemin , aria-valuemax and aria-valuenow attributes. Value to describe the component can be defined using ariaLabelledBy and ariaLabel props.

examples.basic: Number

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Knob is an input component and used with the standard ngModel directive.

examples.basic: <p-knob [(ngModel)]="value" />

sections.label: Color
sections.description: Colors are customized with the textColor , rangeColor and valueColor properties.

examples.basic: <p-knob [(ngModel)]="value" valueColor="SlateGray" rangeColor="MediumTurquoise" />

sections.label: Disabled
sections.description: When disabled is present, a visual hint is applied to indicate that the Knob cannot be interacted with.

examples.basic: <p-knob [(ngModel)]="value" [disabled]="true" />

sections.label: Min/Max
sections.description: Boundaries are configured with the min and max properties whose defaults are 0 and 100 respectively.

examples.basic: <p-knob [(ngModel)]="value" [min]="-50" [max]="50" />

sections.label: Reactive
sections.description: Knob can be controlled with custom controls as well.

sections.label: Reactive Forms
sections.description: Knob can also be used with reactive forms. In this case, the formControlName property is used to bind the component to a form control.

examples.basic: @if (isInvalid('value')) { {{ getErrorMessage('value') }} }
examples.html: @if (isInvalid('value')) { {{ getErrorMessage('value') }} }

sections.label: ReadOnly
sections.description: When readonly present, value cannot be edited.

examples.basic: <p-knob [(ngModel)]="value" [readonly]="true" />

sections.label: Size
sections.description: Diameter of the knob is defined in pixels using the size property.

examples.basic: <p-knob [(ngModel)]="value" [size]="200" />

sections.label: Step
sections.description: Size of each movement is defined with the step property.

examples.basic: <p-knob [(ngModel)]="value" [step]="10" />

sections.label: Stroke
sections.description: The border size is specified with the strokeWidth property as a number in pixels.

examples.basic: <p-knob [(ngModel)]="value" [strokeWidth]="5" />

sections.label: Template
sections.description: Label is a string template that can be customized with the valueTemplate property having 60 as the placeholder .

examples.basic: <p-knob [(ngModel)]="value" valueTemplate="{value}%" />
@if (isInvalid(model)) { {{ getErrorMessage(model) }} }
examples.html: @if (isInvalid(model)) { {{ getErrorMessage(model) }} }

components.name: listbox
components.title: Angular Listbox Component
components.description: Listbox is used to select one or more values from a list of items.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Value to describe the component can be provided ariaLabelledBy or ariaLabel props. The list element has a listbox role with the aria-multiselectable attribute that sets to true when multiple selection is enabled. Each list item has an option role with aria-selected and aria-disabled as their attributes.

examples.basic: Options

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Listbox is used as a controlled component with ngModel property along with an options collection. Label and value of an option are defined with the optionLabel and optionValue properties respectively. Default property name for the optionLabel is label and value for the optionValue . If optionValue is omitted and the object has no value property, the object itself becomes the value of an option. Note that, when options are simple primitive values such as a string array, no optionLabel and optionValue would be necessary.

examples.basic: <p-listbox [options]="cities" [(ngModel)]="selectedCity" optionLabel="name" class="w-full md:w-56" />

sections.label: Checkbox
sections.description: Listbox allows item selection using checkboxes.

examples.basic: <p-listbox [(ngModel)]="selectedCity" [options]="cities" [multiple]="true" [checkbox]="true" optionLabel="name" class="w-full md:w-56" />

sections.label: Checkmark
sections.description: An alternative way to highlight the selected option is displaying a checkmark instead.

examples.basic: <p-listbox [(ngModel)]="selectedCity" [options]="cities" optionLabel="name" [checkmark]="true" [highlightOnSelect]="false" class="w-full md:w-56" />

sections.label: Disabled
sections.description: When disabled is present, the element cannot be edited and focused.

examples.basic: <p-listbox [options]="cities" [(ngModel)]="selectedCity" optionLabel="name" [disabled]="true" class="w-full md:w-56" />

sections.label: dragdrop-doc
sections.description: Items can be reordered using drag and drop by enabling dragdrop property. Depends on @angular/cdk package.

examples.basic: <p-listbox [options]="cities" [(ngModel)]="selectedCity" optionLabel="name" [dragdrop]="true" class="w-full md:w-56" />

sections.label: Filter
sections.description: ListBox provides built-in filtering that is enabled by adding the filter property.

examples.basic: <p-listbox [options]="cities" [(ngModel)]="selectedCity" optionLabel="name" [filter]="true" class="w-full md:w-56" />

sections.label: Group
sections.description: Options can be grouped when a nested data structures is provided.

examples.basic: {{ group.label }}
examples.html: {{ group.label }}

sections.label: Invalid
sections.description: The invalid state is applied using the invalid property to indicate failed validation, which can be integrated with Angular Forms.

examples.basic: <p-listbox [options]="cities" [(ngModel)]="selectedCity" optionLabel="name" class="w-full md:w-56" [invalid]="selectedCity === undefined" />

sections.label: Multiple
sections.description: ListBox allows choosing a single item by default, enable multiple property to choose more than one. When the optional metaKeySelection is present, behavior is changed in a way that selecting a new item requires meta key to be present.

examples.basic: <p-listbox [options]="cities" [(ngModel)]="selectedCities" optionLabel="name" [multiple]="true" [metaKeySelection]="false" class="w-full md:w-56" />

sections.label: reactiveforms-doc
sections.description: Listbox can also be used with reactive forms. In this case, the formControlName property is used to bind the component to a form control.

examples.basic: @if (isInvalid('selectedCity')) { City is required. }
examples.html: @if (isInvalid('selectedCity')) { City is required. }

sections.label: Template
sections.description: For custom content support define a template named item where the default local template variable refers to an option.

examples.basic: {{ country.name }}
examples.html: {{ country.name }}

examples.basic: @if (city.invalid && exampleForm.submitted) { City is required. }
examples.html: @if (city.invalid && exampleForm.submitted) { City is required. }

sections.label: Virtual Scroll
sections.description: VirtualScrolling is an efficient way of rendering the options by displaying a small subset of data in the viewport at any time. When dealing with huge number of options, it is suggested to enable VirtualScrolling to avoid performance issues. Usage is simple as setting virtualScroll property to true and defining virtualScrollItemSize to specify the height of an item.

examples.basic:
<p-listbox
    [options]="items"
    [(ngModel)]="selectedItems"
    [selectAll]="selectAll"
    [filter]="true"
    [checkbox]="true"
    optionLabel="label"
    [virtualScroll]="true"
    [virtualScrollItemSize]="40"
    [multiple]="true"
    [metaKeySelection]="false"
    (onSelectAllChange)="onSelectAllChange($event)"
    (onChange)="onChange($event)"
    scrollHeight="250px"
    [striped]="true"
    class="w-full md:w-56"
/>

props.name: dt
props.description: Defines scoped design tokens of the component.

props.name: unstyled
props.description: Indicates whether the component should be rendered without styles.

props.description: Text to display when filtering does not return any results. Defaults to global value in i18n translation configuration.

props.name: selectionMessage
props.description: Text to be displayed in hidden accessible field when options are selected. Defaults to global value in i18n translation configuration.

props.name: autoOptionFocus
props.description: Whether to focus on the first visible or selected element when the overlay panel is shown.

props.name: ariaLabel
props.description: Defines a string that labels the input for accessibility.

props.description: When enabled, the focused option is selected.

props.description: When enabled, the hovered option will be focused.

props.name: filterMessage
