props.name: filterFields
props.description: Fields used when filtering the options, defaults to optionLabel.

props.name: lazy

props.name: virtualScroll

props.name: virtualScrollItemSize

props.description: Whether to use the scroller feature. The properties of scroller component can be used like an object in it.

props.name: tabindex
props.description: Index of the element in tabbing order.

props.name: multiple

props.name: styleClass

props.name: listStyle
props.description: Inline style of the list element.

props.name: listStyleClass

props.name: readonly
props.description: When present, it specifies that the element value cannot be changed.

props.name: checkbox

props.name: filterMatchMode
props.description: Defines how the items are filtered.

props.name: options

props.name: filterValue

props.name: selectAll

props.name: striped
props.description: Whether to displays rows with alternating colors.

props.name: highlightOnSelect
props.description: Whether the selected option will be add highlight class.

props.name: checkmark
props.description: Whether the selected option will be shown with a check mark.

props.name: dragdrop
props.description: Whether to enable dragdrop based reordering.

props.name: dropListData
props.description: Array to use for CDK drop list data binding. When not provided, uses options array.

props.name: fluid
props.description: Spans 100% width of the container when enabled.

components.name: llms
components.title: LLMs.txt - PrimeNG
components.description: LLM-optimized documentation endpoints for PrimeNG components.

sections.label: /llms-full.txt
sections.description: The llms-full.txt file is a complete list of all the pages in the PrimeNG documentation. It is used to help AI models understand the entire documentation set.

sections.label: /llms.txt
sections.description: The llms.txt file is an industry standard that helps AI models better understand and navigate the PrimeNG documentation. It lists key pages in a structured format, making it easier for LLMs to retrieve relevant information.

sections.label: markdownextension-doc
sections.description: Add a .md to a page's URL to display a Markdown version of that page.

components.name: mcp
components.title: MCP Server - PrimeNG
components.description: Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for PrimeNG component library. Provides AI assistants with comprehensive access to PrimeNG component documentation.

sections.label: Claude Code
sections.description: Add the PrimeNG MCP server using the CLI. After adding, start a new session and use /mcp to verify the connection.

sections.label: Cursor
sections.description: Create .cursor/mcp.json in your project or ~/.cursor/mcp.json for global configuration.

sections.label: exampleprompts-doc
sections.description: Once installed, try asking your AI assistant:

sections.label: Introduction
sections.description: Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open standard that enables AI models to connect with external tools and data sources . The PrimeNG MCP server provides AI assistants with comprehensive access to: Component documentation including props , events , templates , and methods Theming and styling with Pass Through and design tokens Code examples and usage patterns Migration guides for version upgrades Installation and configuration guides

sections.label: OpenAI Codex
sections.description: Add the PrimeNG MCP server using the CLI or edit ~/.codex/config.toml directly.

sections.label: Available Tools
sections.description: Component Information Tools for exploring and understanding PrimeNG components. list_components : List all PrimeNG components with categories get_component : Get detailed info about a specific component search_components : Search components by name or description get_component_props : Get all props for a component get_component_events : Get all events for a component get_component_methods : Get all methods for a component get_component_slots : Get all templates for a component compare_components : Compare two components side by side Code Examples Tools for retrieving code samples and generating templates. get_usage_example : Get code examples for a component list_examples : List all available code examples get_example : Get a specific example by component and section generate_component_template : Generate a basic component template Theming & Styling Tools for customizing component appearance and styling. get_component_pt : Get Pass Through options for DOM customization get_component_tokens : Get design tokens (CSS variables) get_component_styles : Get CSS class names get_theming_guide : Get detailed theming guide get_passthrough_guide : Get Pass Through customization guide get_tailwind_guide : Get Tailwind CSS integration guide Documentation & Guides Tools for accessing PrimeNG documentation and guides. list_guides : List all guides and documentation pages get_guide : Get a specific guide by name get_configuration : Get PrimeNG configuration options get_installation : Get installation instructions get_accessibility_guide : Get accessibility guide get_accessibility_info : Get accessibility info for a component Migration Tools for upgrading between PrimeNG versions. get_migration_guide : Get migration guide overview migrate_v18_to_v19 : v18 to v19 migration guide migrate_v19_to_v20 : v19 to v20 migration guide migrate_v20_to_v21 : v20 to v21 migration guide Search & Discovery Tools for finding components based on various criteria. search_all : Search across components, guides, and props suggest_component : Suggest components based on use case find_by_prop : Find components with a specific prop find_by_event : Find components that emit a specific event find_components_with_feature : Find components supporting a feature get_related_components : Find related components

sections.label: VS Code
sections.description: Create .vscode/mcp.json in your project or ~/Library/Application Support/Code/User/mcp.json for global configuration.

sections.label: Windsurf
sections.description: Edit ~/.codeium/windsurf/mcp_config.json to add the PrimeNG MCP server.

sections.label: Zed
sections.description: Add to your Zed settings at ~/.config/zed/settings.json (Linux) or ~/Library/Application Support/Zed/settings.json (macOS).

components.name: megamenu
components.title: Angular MegaMenu Component
components.description: MegaMenu is navigation component that displays submenus together.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader MegaMenu component uses the menubar role along with aria-orientation and the value to describe the component can either be provided with aria-labelledby or aria-label props. Each list item has a presentation role whereas anchor elements have a menuitem role with aria-label referring to the label of the item and aria-disabled defined if the item is disabled. A submenu within a MegaMenu uses the menu role with an aria-labelledby defined as the id of the submenu root menuitem label. In addition, root menuitems that open a submenu have aria-haspopup , aria-expanded and aria-controls to define the relation between the item and the submenu. Keyboard Support Key Function tab Add focus to the first item if focus moves in to the menu. If the focus is already within the menu, focus moves to the next focusable item in the page tab sequence. shift + tab Add focus to the last item if focus moves in to the menu. If the focus is already within the menu, focus moves to the previous focusable item in the page tab sequence. enter If menuitem has a submenu, toggles the visibility of the submenu otherwise activates the menuitem and closes all open overlays. space If menuitem has a submenu, toggles the visibility of the submenu otherwise activates the menuitem and closes all open overlays. escape If focus is inside a popup submenu, closes the submenu and moves focus to the root item of the closed submenu. down arrow If focus is on a root element, open a submenu and moves focus to the first element in the submenu otherwise moves focus to the next menuitem within the submenu. up arrow If focus is on a root element, opens a submenu and moves focus to the last element in the submenu otherwise moves focus to the previous menuitem within the submenu. right arrow If focus is on a root element, moves focus to the next menuitem. If the focus in inside a submenu, moves focus to the first menuitem of the next menu group. left arrow If focus is on a root element, moves focus to the previous menuitem. If the focus in inside a submenu, moves focus to the first menuitem of the previous menu group. home Moves focus to the first menuitem within the submenu. end Moves focus to the last menuitem within the submenu.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: MegaMenu requires a collection of menuitems as its model .

examples.basic: <p-megamenu [model]="items" />

sections.label: Command
sections.description: The command property of a menuitem defines the callback to run when an item is activated by click or a key event.

sections.label: Router
sections.description: Menu items support navigation via routerLink, programmatic routing using commands, or external URLs.

examples.basic: <p-megamenu [model]="items" />

sections.label: Template
sections.description: Custom content can be placed between p-megamenu tags. Megamenu should be horizontal for custom content.

examples.basic:
{{ item.label }} {{ item.label }} {{ item.subtext }}
{{ item.subtext }}
examples.html:
{{ item.label }} {{ item.label }} {{ item.subtext }}
{{ item.subtext }}

sections.label: Vertical
sections.description: Layout of the MegaMenu is changed with the orientation property that accepts horizontal and vertical as options.

examples.basic: <p-megamenu [model]="items" orientation="vertical" />

components.name: menu
components.title: Angular Menu Component
components.description: Menu is a navigation / command component that supports dynamic and static positioning.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Menu component uses the menu role and the value to describe the menu can either be provided with aria-labelledby or aria-label props. Each list item has a presentation role whereas anchor elements have a menuitem role with aria-label referring to the label of the item and aria-disabled defined if the item is disabled. A submenu within a Menu uses the group role with an aria-labelledby defined as the id of the submenu root menuitem label. In popup mode, the component implicitly manages the aria-expanded , aria-haspopup and aria-controls attributes of the target element to define the relation between the target and the popup. Keyboard Support Key Function tab Add focus to the first item if focus moves in to the menu. If the focus is already within the menu, focus moves to the next focusable item in the page tab sequence. shift + tab Add focus to the last item if focus moves in to the menu. If the focus is already within the menu, focus moves to the previous focusable item in the page tab sequence. enter Activates the focused menuitem. If menu is in overlay mode, popup gets closes and focus moves to target. space Activates the focused menuitem. If menu is in overlay mode, popup gets closes and focus moves to target. escape If menu is in overlay mode, popup gets closes and focus moves to target. down arrow Moves focus to the next menuitem. up arrow Moves focus to the previous menuitem. home Moves focus to the first menuitem. end Moves focus to the last menuitem.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Menu requires a collection of menuitems as its model .

examples.basic: <p-menu [model]="items" />

sections.label: Command
sections.description: The function to invoke when an item is clicked is defined using the command property.

examples.basic:
<p-toast />
<p-menu [model]="items" />

sections.label: Group
sections.description: Menu supports one level of nesting by defining children with items property.

examples.basic: <p-menu [model]="items" />

sections.label: Popup
sections.description: Popup mode is enabled by setting popup property to true and calling toggle method with an event of the target.

examples.basic:
<p-menu #menu [model]="items" [popup]="true" />
<p-button (click)="menu.toggle($event)" icon="pi pi-ellipsis-v" />

sections.label: Router
sections.description: Menu items support navigation via routerLink, programmatic routing using commands, or external URLs.

examples.basic: <p-menu [model]="items" />

sections.label: Template
sections.description: Menu offers item customization with the item template that receives the menuitem instance from the model as a parameter. The submenu header has its own submenuheader template, additional slots named start and end are provided to embed content before or after the menu.

examples.basic: PRIMEAPP {{ item.label }} {{ item.label }} {{ item.shortcut }}
examples.html: PRIMEAPP {{ item.label }} {{ item.label }} {{ item.shortcut }}

components.name: menubar
components.title: Angular Menubar Component
components.description: Menubar is a horizontal menu component.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Menubar component uses the menubar role and the value to describe the menu can either be provided with aria-labelledby or aria-label props. Each list item has a presentation role whereas anchor elements have a menuitem role with aria-label referring to the label of the item and aria-disabled defined if the item is disabled. A submenu within a MenuBar uses the menu role with an aria-labelledby defined as the id of the submenu root menuitem label. In addition, menuitems that open a submenu have aria-haspopup , aria-expanded and aria-controls to define the relation between the item and the submenu. In mobile viewports, a menu icon appears with a button role along with aria-haspopup , aria-expanded and aria-controls to manage the relation between the overlay menubar and the button. The value to describe the button can be defined aria-label or aria-labelledby specified using buttonProps , by default navigation key of the aria property from the locale API as the aria-label . Keyboard Support Key Function tab Add focus to the first item if focus moves in to the menu. If the focus is already within the menu, focus moves to the next focusable item in the page tab sequence. shift + tab Add focus to the last item if focus moves in to the menu. If the focus is already within the menu, focus moves to the previous focusable item in the page tab sequence. enter If menuitem has a submenu, toggles the visibility of the submenu otherwise activates the menuitem and closes all open overlays. space If menuitem has a submenu, toggles the visibility of the submenu otherwise activates the menuitem and closes all open overlays. escape If focus is inside a popup submenu, closes the submenu and moves focus to the root item of the closed submenu. down arrow If focus is on a root element, open a submenu and moves focus to the first element in the submenu otherwise moves focus to the next menuitem within the submenu. up arrow If focus is on a root element, opens a submenu and moves focus to the last element in the submenu otherwise moves focus to the previous menuitem within the submenu. right arrow If focus is on a root element, moves focus to the next menuitem otherwise opens a submenu if there is one available and moves focus to the first item. left arrow If focus is on a root element, moves focus to the previous menuitem otherwise closes a submenu and moves focus to the root item of the closed submenu. home Moves focus to the first menuitem within the submenu. end Moves focus to the last menuitem within the submenu.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Menubar requires nested menuitems as its model.

examples.basic: <p-menubar [model]="items" />

sections.label: Command
sections.description: The command property defines the callback to run when an item is activated by click or a key event.

sections.description: Menu items support navigation via routerLink, programmatic routing using commands, or external URLs.

components.name: message
components.title: Angular Message Component
components.description: Message component is used to display inline messages.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Message component uses alert role that implicitly defines aria-live as "assertive" and aria-atomic as "true". Since any attribute is passed to the root element, attributes like aria-labelledby and aria-label can optionally be used as well. Close element is a button with an aria-label that refers to the aria.close property of the locale API by default. Close Button Keyboard Support Key Function enter Closes the message. space Closes the message.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Message component requires a content to display.

examples.basic: <p-message>Message Content</p-message>
examples.html: Message Content

sections.label: Closable
sections.description: Enable closable option to display an icon to remove a message.

examples.basic: <p-message closable>Closable Message</p-message>
examples.html: Closable Message

sections.label: Dynamic
sections.description: Multiple messages can be displayed using the standard for block.

examples.basic: @for (message of messages(); track message.severity; let first = $first) { }
examples.html: @for (message of messages(); track message.severity; let first = $first) { }

sections.label: form-doc
sections.description: Validation errors in a form are displayed with the error severity.

examples.basic:
Validation Failed
@if (!username) { Username is required }
@if (!phone) { Phone number is required }
examples.html:
Validation Failed
@if (!username) { Username is required }
@if (!phone) { Phone number is required }

sections.label: Icon
sections.description: The icon of a message is specified with the icon property.

examples.basic: How may I help you?
examples.html: How may I help you?

sections.label: Life
sections.description: Messages can disappear automatically by defined the life in milliseconds.

examples.basic:
<p-button label="Show" (onClick)="showMessage()" [disabled]="visible()" styleClass="mb-4" />
@if (visible()) {
    <p-message [life]="3000" severity="success">Auto disappear message</p-message>
}
examples.html: @if (visible()) { Auto disappear message }

sections.label: Outlined
sections.description: Configure the variant value as outlined for messages with borders and no background.

examples.basic:
<p-message severity="success" variant="outlined">Success Message</p-message>
<p-message severity="info" variant="outlined">Info Message</p-message>
<p-message severity="warn" variant="outlined">Warn Message</p-message>
<p-message severity="error" variant="outlined">Error Message</p-message>
<p-message severity="secondary" variant="outlined">Secondary Message</p-message>
<p-message severity="contrast" variant="outlined">Contrast Message</p-message>
examples.html: Success Message Info Message Warn Message Error Message Secondary Message Contrast Message

sections.label: Severity
sections.description: The severity option specifies the type of the message.

examples.basic:
<p-message severity="success">Success Message</p-message>
<p-message severity="info">Info Message</p-message>

components.name: metergroup
components.title: Angular MeterGroup Component
components.description: MeterGroup displays scalar measurements within a known range.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader MeterGroup component uses meter role in addition to the aria-valuemin , aria-valuemax and aria-valuenow attributes. Value to describe the component can be defined using aria-labelledby prop. Keyboard Support Component does not include any interactive elements.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: MeterGroup requires a value as the data to display where each item in the collection should be a type of MeterItem .

examples.basic: <p-metergroup [value]="value" />

sections.label: Icon
sections.description: Icons can be displayed next to the labels instead of the default marker.

examples.basic: <p-metergroup [value]="value" />

sections.label: Label
sections.description: The position of the labels relative to the meters is defined using the labelPosition property. The default orientation of the labels is horizontal, and the vertical alternative is available through the labelOrientation option.

examples.basic: <p-metergroup [value]="value" labelPosition="start" labelOrientation="vertical" />

sections.label: Min Max
sections.description: Boundaries are configured with the min and max values whose defaults are 0 and 100 respectively.

examples.basic: <p-metergroup [value]="value" [max]="200" />

sections.label: Multiple
sections.description: Adding more items to the array displays the meters in a group.

examples.basic: <p-metergroup [value]="value" />

sections.label: Template
sections.description: MeterGroup provides templating support for labels, meter items, and content around the meters.

examples.basic:
{{ meterItem.label }} {{ meterItem.value }}%
Storage {{ totalPercent }}% 1TB
examples.html:
{{ meterItem.label }} {{ meterItem.value }}%
Storage {{ totalPercent }}% 1TB
examples.typescript:
import { Component } from '@angular/core'; import { ButtonModule } from 'primeng/button'; import { CardModule } from 'primeng/card'; import { MeterGroupModule } from 'primeng/metergroup'; @Component({ template: `
{{ meterItem.label }} {{ meterItem.value }}%
Storage {{ totalPercent }}% 1TB
`, standalone: true, imports: [ButtonModule, CardModule, MeterGroupModule] }) export class MetergroupTemplateDemo { value: any[]; }

sections.label: Vertical
sections.description: Layout of the MeterGroup is configured with the orientation property that accepts either horizontal or vertical as available options.

examples.basic: <p-metergroup [value]="value" orientation="vertical" labelOrientation="vertical" [style]="{ height: '300px' }" />

components.name: multiselect
components.title: Angular MultiSelect Component
components.description: MultiSelect is used to select multiple items from a collection.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Value to describe the component can either be provided with ariaLabelledBy or ariaLabel props. The multiselect component has a combobox role in addition to aria-haspopup and aria-expanded attributes. The relation between the combobox and the popup is created with aria-controls attribute that refers to the id of the popup listbox. The popup listbox uses listbox as the role with aria-multiselectable enabled. Each list item has an option role along with aria-label , aria-selected and aria-disabled attributes. Checkbox component at the header uses a hidden native checkbox element internally that is only visible to screen readers. Value to read is defined with the selectAll and unselectAll keys of the aria property from the locale API. If filtering is enabled, filterInputProps can be defined to give aria-* props to the input element. Close button uses close key of the aria property from the locale API as the aria-label by default, this can be overriden with the closeButtonProps .

examples.basic: Options

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: MultiSelect is used as a controlled component with ngModel property along with an options collection. Label and value of an option are defined with the optionLabel and optionValue properties respectively. Default property name for the optionLabel is label and value for the optionValue . If optionValue is omitted and the object has no value property, the object itself becomes the value of an option. Note that, when options are simple primitive values such as a string array, no optionLabel and optionValue would be necessary.

examples.basic: <p-multiselect [options]="cities" [(ngModel)]="selectedCities" optionLabel="name" placeholder="Select Cities" [maxSelectedLabels]="3" class="w-full md:w-80" />

sections.label: Chips
sections.description: Selected values are displayed as a comma separated list by default, setting display as chip displays them as chips.

examples.basic: <p-multiselect [options]="cities" [(ngModel)]="selectedCities" placeholder="Select Cities" optionLabel="name" display="chip" class="w-full md:w-80" />

sections.label: Clear Icon
sections.description: When showClear is enabled, a clear icon is displayed to clear the value.

examples.basic: <p-multiselect [options]="cities" [(ngModel)]="selectedCities" optionLabel="name" placeholder="Select Cities" [maxSelectedLabels]="3" class="w-full md:w-80" [showClear]="true" />

sections.label: Disabled
sections.description: When disabled is present, the element cannot be edited and focused.

examples.basic: <p-multiselect [options]="cities" [(ngModel)]="selectedCities" [disabled]="true" optionLabel="name" placeholder="Select Cities" class="w-full md:w-80" />

sections.label: Filled
sections.description: Specify the variant property as filled to display the component with a higher visual emphasis than the default outlined style.

examples.basic: <p-multiselect [options]="cities" [(ngModel)]="selectedCities" variant="filled" optionLabel="name" placeholder="Select Cities" [maxSelectedLabels]="3" class="w-full md:w-80" />

sections.label: Filter
sections.description: MultiSelect provides built-in filtering that is enabled by adding the filter property.

examples.basic: <p-multiselect [options]="cities" [(ngModel)]="selectedCities" [filter]="true" optionLabel="name" placeholder="Select Cities" [maxSelectedLabels]="3" class="w-full md:w-80" />

sections.label: Float Label
sections.description: A floating label appears on top of the input field when focused. Visit FloatLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<p-floatlabel class="w-full md:w-80">
    <p-multiselect id="over_label" [(ngModel)]="value1" [options]="cities" optionLabel="name" filter [maxSelectedLabels]="3" class="w-full" />
    <label for="over_label">Over Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>
<p-floatlabel class="w-full md:w-80" variant="in">
    <p-multiselect id="in_label" [(ngModel)]="value2" [options]="cities" optionLabel="name" filter [maxSelectedLabels]="3" class="w-full" />
    <label for="in_label">In Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>
<p-floatlabel class="w-full md:w-80" variant="on">
    <p-multiselect id="on_label" [(ngModel)]="value3" [options]="cities" optionLabel="name" filter [maxSelectedLabels]="3" class="w-full" />
    <label for="on_label">On Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>

sections.label: Fluid
sections.description: The fluid prop makes the component take up the full width of its container when set to true.

examples.basic: <p-multiselect [options]="cities" [(ngModel)]="selectedCities" optionLabel="name" placeholder="Select Cities" [maxSelectedLabels]="3" fluid />

sections.label: Group
sections.description: Options can be grouped when a nested data structures is provided.

examples.basic: {{ group.label }}
examples.html: {{ group.label }}

sections.label: Ifta Label
sections.description: IftaLabel is used to create infield top aligned labels. Visit IftaLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<p-iftalabel class="w-full md:w-80">
    <p-multiselect [(ngModel)]="selectedCities" inputId="ms_cities" [options]="cities" optionLabel="name" [filter]="true" [maxSelectedLabels]="3" class="w-full" />
    <label for="ms_cities">Cities</label>
</p-iftalabel>

sections.label: Invalid
sections.description: The invalid state is applied using the invalid property to indicate failed validation, which can be integrated with Angular Forms.

examples.basic:
<p-multiselect [options]="cities" [(ngModel)]="selectedCities1" [invalid]="value1" optionLabel="name" placeholder="Select Cities" [maxSelectedLabels]="3" class="w-full md:w-80" />
<p-multiselect [options]="cities" [(ngModel)]="selectedCities2" [invalid]="value2" optionLabel="name" placeholder="Select Cities" [maxSelectedLabels]="3" class="w-full md:w-80" variant="filled" />

sections.label: Loading State
sections.description: Loading state can be used loading property.

examples.basic: <p-multiselect [options]="cities" [(ngModel)]="selectedCities" [loading]="true" optionLabel="name" placeholder="Loading..." class="w-full md:w-80" />

sections.label: reactiveforms-doc
sections.description: MultiSelect can also be used with reactive forms. In this case, the formControlName property is used to bind the component to a form control.

examples.basic: @if (isInvalid('city')) { City is required. }
examples.html: @if (isInvalid('city')) { City is required. }

sections.label: Sizes
sections.description: MultiSelect provides small and large sizes as alternatives to the base.

examples.basic:
<p-multiselect [(ngModel)]="value1" [options]="cities" optionLabel="name" [maxSelectedLabels]="3" class="w-full md:w-80" size="small" placeholder="Small" />
<p-multiselect [(ngModel)]="value2" [options]="cities" optionLabel="name" [maxSelectedLabels]="3" class="w-full md:w-80" placeholder="Normal" />
<p-multiselect [(ngModel)]="value3" [options]="cities" optionLabel="name" [maxSelectedLabels]="3" class="w-full md:w-80" size="large" placeholder="Large" />

sections.label: Template
sections.description: Available options and the selected options support customization with item and selecteditems templates respectively. In addition, header, footer and filter sections can be templated as well.

examples.basic:
{{ country.name }}
Available Countries
examples.html:
{{ country.name }}
Available Countries

examples.basic: @if (city.invalid && (city.touched || exampleForm.submitted)) { City is required. }
examples.html: @if (city.invalid && (city.touched || exampleForm.submitted)) { City is required. }

sections.label: VirtualScroll
sections.description: VirtualScrolling is an efficient way of rendering the options by displaying a small subset of data in the viewport at any time. When dealing with huge number of options, it is suggested to enable VirtualScrolling to avoid performance issues. Usage is simple as setting virtualScroll property to true and defining virtualScrollItemSize to specify the height of an item.

components.name: orderlist
components.title: Angular OrderList Component
components.description: OrderList is used to sort a collection.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Value to describe the source listbox and target listbox can be provided with sourceListProps and targetListProps by passing aria-labelledby or aria-label props. The list elements has a listbox role with the aria-multiselectable attribute. Each list item has an option role with aria-selected and aria-disabled as their attributes. Controls buttons are button elements with an aria-label that refers to the aria.moveTop , aria.moveUp , aria.moveDown , aria.moveBottom , aria.moveTo , aria.moveAllTo , aria.moveFrom and aria.moveAllFrom properties of the locale API by default, alternatively you may use moveTopButtonProps , moveUpButtonProps , moveDownButtonProps , moveToButtonProps , moveAllToButtonProps , moveFromButtonProps , moveFromButtonProps and moveAllFromButtonProps to customize the buttons like overriding the default aria-label attributes. OrderList Keyboard Support Key Function tab Moves focus to the first selected option, if there is none then first option receives the focus. up arrow Moves focus to the previous option. down arrow Moves focus to the next option. enter Toggles the selected state of the focused option. space Toggles the selected state of the focused option. home Moves focus to the first option. end Moves focus to the last option. shift + down arrow Moves focus to the next option and toggles the selection state. shift + up arrow Moves focus to the previous option and toggles the selection state. shift + space Selects the items between the most recently selected option and the focused option. control + shift + home Selects the focused options and all the options up to the first one. control + shift + end Selects the focused options and all the options down to the first one. control + a Selects all options. Buttons Keyboard Support Key Function enter Executes button action. space Executes button action.

components.name: overlay
components.title: Overlay API - PrimeNG
components.description: This API allows overlay components to be controlled from the PrimeNG. In this way, all overlay components in the application can have the same behavior.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Overlay component uses dialog role and since any attribute is passed to the root element you may define attributes like aria-label or aria-labelledby to describe the popup contents. In addition aria-modal is added since focus is kept within the popup. It is recommended to use a trigger component that can be accessed with keyboard such as a button, if not adding tabIndex would be necessary. Overlay adds aria-expanded state attribute and aria-controls to the trigger so that the relation between the trigger and the popup is defined. Overlay Keyboard Support When the popup gets opened, the first focusable element receives the focus and this can be customized by adding autofocus to an element within the popup. Key Function tab Moves focus to the next the focusable element within the popup. shift + tab Moves focus to the previous the focusable element within the popup. escape Closes the popup and moves focus to the trigger. Close Button Keyboard Support Key Function enter Closes the popup and moves focus to the trigger. space Closes the popup and moves focus to the trigger.

sections.label: appendto-doc
sections.description: Overlay can be mounted into its location, body or DOM element instance using this option.

sections.label: autozindex-doc
sections.description: The autoZIndex determines whether to automatically manage layering. Its default value is 'false'.

sections.label: basezindex-doc
sections.description: The baseZIndex is base zIndex value to use in layering. Its default value is 0.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Overlay is a container to display content in an overlay window. All the options mentioned above can be used as props for this component.

examples.basic:
<p-button (click)="toggle()" label="Show Overlay"></p-button>
<p-overlay [(visible)]="overlayVisible" [responsive]="{ breakpoint: '640px', direction: 'bottom', contentStyleClass: 'h-20rem' }" contentStyleClass="p-6 bg-surface-0 dark:bg-surface-900 shadow rounded-border"> Content </p-overlay>

</section>

sections.label: hideonescape-doc
sections.description: The hideOnEscape determines to hide the overlay when escape key pressed. Accepts boolean, default value is false .

sections.label: Mode
sections.description: It has two valid values; overlay and modal . In overlay mode, a container element is opened like overlaypanel or dropdown's panel. In modal mode, the container element behaves like popup. This behaviour is similar to a dialog component.

sections.label: Responsive
sections.description: It is the option used to determine in which mode it should appear according to the given media or breakpoint .

components.name: paginator
components.title: Angular Paginator Component
components.description: Paginator displays data in paged format and provides navigation between pages.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Paginator is placed inside a nav element to indicate a navigation section. All of the paginator elements can be customized using templating however the default behavious is listed below. First, previous, next and last page navigators elements with aria-label attributes referring to the aria.firstPageLabel , aria.prevPageLabel , aria.nextPageLabel and aria.lastPageLabel properties of the locale API respectively. Page links are also button elements with an aria-label attribute derived from the aria.pageLabel of the locale API. Current page is marked with aria-current set to "page" as well. Current page report uses aria-live="polite" to instruct screen reader about the changes to the pagination state. Rows per page dropdown internally uses a dropdown component, refer to the dropdown documentation for accessibility details. Additionally, the dropdown uses an aria-label from the aria.rowsPerPage property of the locale API. Jump to page input is an input element with an aria-label that refers to the aria.jumpToPage property of the locale API. Keyboard Support Key Function tab Moves focus through the paginator elements. enter Executes the paginator element action. space Executes the paginator element action. Rows Per Page Dropdown Keyboard Support Refer to the dropdown documentation for more details about keyboard support.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Paginator is used as a controlled component with first , rows and onPageChange properties to manage the first index and number of records to display per page. Total number of records need to be with totalRecords property. Default template includes a dropdown to change the rows so rowsPerPageOptions is also necessary for the dropdown options.

examples.basic: <p-paginator (onPageChange)="onPageChange($event)" [first]="first" [rows]="rows" [totalRecords]="120" [rowsPerPageOptions]="[10, 20, 30]" />

sections.label: currentpagereport-doc
sections.description: Current page report item in the template displays information about the pagination state. Default value is ({{ '{' }}currentPage{{ '}' }} of {{ '{' }}totalPages{{ '}' }}) whereas available placeholders are the following; {{ '{' }}currentPage{{ '}' }} {{ '{' }}totalPages{{ '}' }} {{ '{' }}rows{{ '}' }} {{ '{' }}first{{ '}' }} {{ '{' }}last{{ '}' }} {{ '{' }}totalRecords{{ '}' }}

examples.basic:
<p-paginator
    (onPageChange)="onPageChange($event)"
    [first]="first"
    [rows]="rows"
    [totalRecords]="120"
    [showCurrentPageReport]="true"
    [showPageLinks]="false"
    [showJumpToPageDropdown]="false"
    currentPageReportTemplate="Showing {first} to {last} of {totalRecords}"
/>

sections.label: Images
sections.description: Sample image gallery implementation using paginator.

sections.label: Template
sections.description: Templating allows overriding the default content of the UI elements by defining callbacks using the element name.

components.name: panel
components.title: Angular Panel Component
components.description: Panel is a container component with an optional content toggle feature.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Toggleable panels use a content toggle button at the header that has aria-controls to define the id of the content section along with aria-expanded for the visibility state. The value to read the button defaults to the value of the header property and can be customized by defining an aria-label or aria-labelledby via the toggleButtonProps property. The content uses region , defines an id that matches the aria-controls of the content toggle button and aria-labelledby referring to the id of the header. Content Toggle Button Keyboard Support Key Function tab Moves focus to the next the focusable element in the page tab sequence. shift + tab Moves focus to the previous the focusable element in the page tab sequence. enter Toggles the visibility of the content. space Toggles the visibility of the content.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: A simple Panel is created with a header property along with the content as children.

components.name: panelmenu
components.title: Angular PanelMenu Component
components.description: PanelMenu is a hybrid of Accordion and Tree components.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Accordion header elements have a button role, an aria-label defined using the label property of the menuitem model and aria-controls to define the id of the content section along with aria-expanded for the visibility state. The content of an accordion panel uses region role, defines an id that matches the aria-controls of the header and aria-labelledby referring to the id of the header. The tree elements has a tree as the role and each menu item has a treeitem role along with aria-label , aria-selected and aria-expanded attributes. The container element of a treenode has the group role. The aria-setsize , aria-posinset and aria-level attributes are calculated implicitly and added to each treeitem. Header Keyboard Support Key Function tab Adds focus to the first header when focus moves in to the component, if there is already a focused tab header then moves the focus out of the component based on the page tab sequence. enter Toggles the visibility of the content. space Toggles the visibility of the content. down arrow If panel is collapsed then moves focus to the next header, otherwise first treenode of the panel receives the focus. up arrow If previous panel is collapsed then moves focus to the previous header, otherwise last treenode of the previous panel receives the focus. home Moves focus to the first header. end Moves focus to the last header. Tree Keyboard Support Key Function tab Moves focus to the next focusable element in the page tab order. shift + tab Moves focus to the previous focusable element in the page tab order. enter Activates the focused treenode. space Activates the focused treenode. down arrow Moves focus to the next treenode. up arrow Moves focus to the previous treenode. right arrow If node is closed, opens the node otherwise moves focus to the first child node. left arrow If node is open, closes the node otherwise moves focus to the parent node.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: PanelMenu requires a collection of menuitems as its model .

examples.basic: <p-panelmenu [model]="items" class="w-full md:w-80" />

sections.label: Command
sections.description: The command property defines the callback to run when an item is activated by click or a key event.

examples.basic:
<p-toast />
<p-panelmenu [model]="items" class="w-full md:w-80" />

sections.label: Controlled
sections.description: Menu items can be controlled programmatically.

examples.basic:
<p-button label="Toggle All" [text]="true" (onClick)="toggleAll()" />
<p-panelmenu [model]="items" class="w-full md:w-80" />

sections.label: Multiple
sections.description: Only one single root menuitem can be active by default, enable multiple property to be able to open more than one items.

examples.basic: <p-panelmenu [model]="items" styleClass="w-full md:w-80" [multiple]="true" />

sections.label: Router
sections.description: Menu items support navigation via routerLink, programmatic routing using commands, or external URLs.

examples.basic: <p-panelmenu [model]="items" class="w-full md:w-80" />

sections.label: Template
sections.description: PanelMenu requires a collection of menuitems as its model .

components.name: password
components.title: Angular Password Component
components.description: Password displays strength indicator for password fields.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Value to describe the component can either be provided via label tag combined with id prop or using ariaLabelledBy , ariaLabel props. Screen reader is notified about the changes to the strength of the password using a section that has aria-live while typing.

examples.basic: Password

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Two-way value binding is defined using ngModel .

examples.basic: <p-password [(ngModel)]="value" [feedback]="false" autocomplete="off" />

sections.label: Clear Icon
sections.description: When showClear is enabled, a clear icon is displayed to clear the value.

examples.basic: <p-password [(ngModel)]="value" [feedback]="false" autocomplete="off" [showClear]="true" inputStyleClass="w-56" />

sections.label: Disabled
sections.description: When disabled is present, the element cannot be edited and focused.

examples.basic: <p-password [(ngModel)]="value" [disabled]="true" placeholder="Disabled" autocomplete="off" />

sections.label: Filled
sections.description: Specify the variant property as filled to display the component with a higher visual emphasis than the default outlined style.

examples.basic: <p-password [(ngModel)]="value" [feedback]="false" variant="filled" autocomplete="off" />

sections.label: Float Label
sections.description: A floating label appears on top of the input field when focused. Visit FloatLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<p-floatlabel>
    <p-password [(ngModel)]="value1" inputId="over_label" autocomplete="off" />
    <label for="over_label">Over Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>
<p-floatlabel variant="in">
    <p-password [(ngModel)]="value2" inputId="in_label" autocomplete="off" />
    <label for="in_label">In Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>
<p-floatlabel variant="on">
    <p-password [(ngModel)]="value3" inputId="on_label" autocomplete="off" />
    <label for="on_label">On Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>

sections.label: Fluid
sections.description: The fluid prop makes the component take up the full width of its container when set to true.

examples.basic: <p-password [(ngModel)]="value" [feedback]="false" autocomplete="off" fluid />

sections.label: Ifta Label
sections.description: IftaLabel is used to create infield top aligned labels. Visit IftaLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<p-iftalabel>
    <p-password [(ngModel)]="value" inputId="password" autocomplete="off" />
    <label for="password">Password</label>
</p-iftalabel>

sections.label: Invalid
sections.description: The invalid state is applied using the invalid property to indicate failed validation, which can be integrated with Angular Forms.

examples.basic:
<p-password [(ngModel)]="value1" [invalid]="!value1" placeholder="Password" />
<p-password [(ngModel)]="value2" [invalid]="!value2" variant="filled" placeholder="Password" />

sections.label: Locale
sections.description: Labels are translated at component level by promptLabel , weakLabel , mediumLabel and strongLabel properties. In order to apply global translations for all Password components in the application, refer to the locale

examples.basic: <p-password [(ngModel)]="value" promptLabel="Choose a password" weakLabel="Too simple" mediumLabel="Average complexity" strongLabel="Complex password" autocomplete="off" />

sections.label: Meter
sections.description: Strength meter is displayed as a popup while a value is being entered.

examples.basic: <p-password [(ngModel)]="value" autocomplete="off" />

sections.label: reactiveforms-doc
sections.description: Password can also be used with reactive forms. In this case, the formControlName property is used to bind the component to a form control.

examples.basic: @if (isInvalid('value')) { Password is required. }
examples.html: @if (isInvalid('value')) { Password is required. }

sections.label: Sizes
sections.description: Password provides small and large sizes as alternatives to the base.

examples.basic:
<p-password [(ngModel)]="value1" type="text" size="small" placeholder="Small" />
<p-password [(ngModel)]="value2" type="text" placeholder="Normal" />
<p-password [(ngModel)]="value3" type="text" size="large" placeholder="Large" />

sections.label: Template
sections.description: 3 templates are included to customize the overlay. These are header , content and footer . Note that content overrides the default meter.

examples.basic:
Reset Password
  • At least one lowercase
  • At least one uppercase
  • At least one numeric
  • Minimum 8 characters
examples.html:
Reset Password
  • At least one lowercase
  • At least one uppercase
  • At least one numeric
  • Minimum 8 characters

examples.basic: @if (model.invalid && (model.touched || exampleForm.submitted)) { Password is required. }
examples.html: @if (model.invalid && (model.touched || exampleForm.submitted)) { Password is required. }

sections.label: Toggle Mask
sections.description: When toggleMask is present, an icon is displayed to show the value as plain text.

examples.basic: <p-password [(ngModel)]="value" [toggleMask]="true" autocomplete="off" />

components.name: picklist
components.title: Angular PickList Component
components.description: PickList is used to reorder items between different lists.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Value to describe the source listbox and target listbox can be provided with ariaLabelledBy or ariaLabel props. The list elements has a listbox role with the aria-multiselectable attribute. Each list item has an option role with aria-selected and aria-disabled as their attributes. Controls buttons are button elements with an aria-label that refers to the aria.moveTop , aria.moveUp , aria.moveDown , aria.moveBottom , aria.moveTo , aria.moveAllTo , aria.moveFrom and aria.moveAllFrom properties of the locale API by default, alternatively you may use moveTopButtonProps , moveUpButtonProps , moveDownButtonProps , moveToButtonProps , moveAllToButtonProps , moveFromButtonProps , moveFromButtonProps and moveAllFromButtonProps to customize the buttons like overriding the default aria-label attributes. PickList Keyboard Support Key Function tab Moves focus to the first selected option, if there is none then first option receives the focus. up arrow Moves focus to the previous option. down arrow Moves focus to the next option. enter Toggles the selected state of the focused option. space Toggles the selected state of the focused option. home Moves focus to the first option. end Moves focus to the last option. shift + down arrow Moves focus to the next option and toggles the selection state. shift + up arrow Moves focus to the previous option and toggles the selection state. shift + space Selects the items between the most recently selected option and the focused option. control + shift + home Selects the focused options and all the options up to the first one. control + shift + end Selects the focused options and all the options down to the first one. control + a Selects all options. Buttons Keyboard Support Key Function enter Executes button action. space Executes button action.

examples.html: Options

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: PickList is used as a controlled input with source and target properties. Content of a list item needs to be defined with the item template that receives an object in the list as parameter. Drag & drop functionality depends on @angular/cdk package.

examples.basic:
<p-picklist [source]="sourceProducts()" [target]="targetProducts()" [dragdrop]="true" [responsive]="true" breakpoint="1400px">
    <ng-template let-item #item>
        {{ item.name }}
    </ng-template>
</p-picklist>
examples.html: {{ item.name }}

sections.label: Filter
sections.description: Filter value is checked against the property of an object configured with the filterBy property.

examples.basic:
{{ option.name }} {{ option.category }}
{{ '$' + option.price }}
examples.html:
{{ option.name }} {{ option.category }}
{{ '$' + option.price }}

sections.label: Template
sections.description: For custom content support define an item template that gets the item instance as a parameter. In addition sourceheader and targetheader templates are provided for further customization.

components.name: popover
components.title: Angular Popover Component
components.description: Popover is a container component that can overlay other components on page.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Popover component uses dialog role and since any attribute is passed to the root element you may define attributes like aria-label or aria-labelledby to describe the popup contents. In addition aria-modal is added since focus is kept within the popup. It is recommended to use a trigger component that can be accessed with keyboard such as a button, if not adding tabIndex would be necessary. Popover adds aria-expanded state attribute and aria-controls to the trigger so that the relation between the trigger and the popup is defined. Popover Keyboard Support When the popup gets opened, the first focusable element receives the focus and this can be customized by adding autofocus to an element within the popup. Key Function tab Moves focus to the next the focusable element within the popup. shift + tab Moves focus to the previous the focusable element within the popup. escape Closes the popup and moves focus to the trigger. Close Button Keyboard Support Key Function enter Closes the popup and moves focus to the trigger. space Closes the popup and moves focus to the trigger.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Popover is accessed via its reference and visibility is controlled using toggle , show and hide methods with an event of the target.

components.name: progressbar
components.title: Angular ProgressBar Component
components.description: ProgressBar is a process status indicator.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader ProgressBar components uses progressbar role along with aria-valuemin , aria-valuemax and aria-valuenow attributes. Value to describe the component can be defined using aria-labelledby and aria-label props.

examples.html: Status

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: ProgressBar is used with the value property.

examples.basic: <p-progressbar [value]="50" />

sections.label: Dynamic
sections.description: Value is reactive so updating it dynamically changes the bar as well.

examples.basic:
<p-toast />
<p-progressbar [value]="value" />

sections.label: Indeterminate
sections.description: For progresses with no value to track, set the mode property to indeterminate .

examples.basic: <p-progressbar mode="indeterminate" [style]="{ height: '6px' }" />

sections.label: Template
sections.description: content template allows displaying custom content inside the progressbar.

examples.basic: {{ value }}/100
examples.html: {{ value }}/100

components.name: radiobutton
components.title: Angular RadioButton Component
components.description: RadioButton is an extension to standard radio button element with theming.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader RadioButton component uses a hidden native radio button element internally that is only visible to screen readers. Value to describe the component can either be provided via label tag combined with inputId prop or using ariaLabelledBy , ariaLabel props.

examples.basic: Two

sections.label: Disabled
sections.description: When disabled is present, the element cannot be edited and focused.

examples.basic:
<p-radiobutton [(ngModel)]="value" [value]="1" [disabled]="true" />
<p-radiobutton [(ngModel)]="value" [value]="2" [disabled]="true" />

sections.label: Dynamic
sections.description: RadioButtons can be generated using a list of values.

sections.label: Filled
sections.description: Specify the variant property as filled to display the component with a higher visual emphasis than the default outlined style.

examples.basic: <p-radiobutton [(ngModel)]="checked" variant="filled" />

sections.label: Group
sections.description: RadioButton is used as a controlled input with value and ngModel properties.

examples.typescript:
import { Component } from '@angular/core'; import { FormsModule } from '@angular/forms'; import { RadioButtonModule } from 'primeng/radiobutton'; @Component({ template: `
`, standalone: true, imports: [RadioButtonModule, FormsModule] }) export class RadiobuttonGroupDemo { ingredient!: string; }

sections.label: Invalid
sections.description: The invalid state is applied using the invalid property to indicate failed validation, which can be integrated with Angular Forms.

examples.basic: <p-radiobutton [(ngModel)]="value" [invalid]="!value" />

sections.label: reactiveforms-doc
sections.description: RadioButton can also be used with reactive forms. In this case, the formControlName property is used to bind the component to a form control.

components.name: rating
components.title: Angular Rating Component
components.description: Rating component is a star based selection input.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Rating component internally uses radio buttons that are only visible to screen readers. The value to read for item is retrieved from the locale API via star and stars of the aria property.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Two-way value binding is defined using ngModel .

examples.basic: <p-rating [(ngModel)]="value" />

sections.label: Disabled
sections.description: When disabled is present, a visual hint is applied to indicate that the Knob cannot be interacted with.

examples.basic: <p-rating [(ngModel)]="value" [disabled]="true" />

sections.label: Number of Stars
sections.description: Number of stars to display is defined with stars property.

examples.basic: <p-rating [(ngModel)]="value" [stars]="10" />

sections.label: reactiveforms-doc
sections.description: Rating can also be used with reactive forms. In this case, the formControlName property is used to bind the component to a form control.

examples.basic: @if (isInvalid('ratingValue')) { Value is required. }
examples.html: @if (isInvalid('ratingValue')) { Value is required. }

sections.label: Readonly

components.name: scroller
components.title: Angular Virtual Scroller Component
components.description: VirtualScroller is a performance-approach to handle huge data efficiently.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader VirtualScroller uses a semantic list element to list the items. No specific role is enforced, still you may use any aria role and attributes as any valid attribute is passed to the container element. Keyboard Support Component does not include any built-in interactive elements.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: VirtualScroller requires items as the data to display, itemSize for the dimensions of an item and item template are required on component. In addition, an initial array is required based on the total number of items to display. Size of the viewport is configured using scrollWidth , scrollHeight properties directly or with CSS width and height styles.

examples.basic: {{ item }}
examples.html: {{ item }}

sections.label: Delay
sections.description: Scroll delay is adjusted by using delay property.

examples.basic:
No Delay
{{ item }}
150ms
{{ item }}
500ms
{{ item }}
examples.html:
No Delay
{{ item }}
150ms
{{ item }}
500ms
{{ item }}

sections.label: Grid
sections.description: Scrolling can be enabled vertically and horizontally when orientation is set as both . In this mode, itemSize should be an array where first value is the height of an item and second is the width.

examples.basic: {{ el }}
examples.html: {{ el }}

sections.label: Horizontal
sections.description: Setting orientation to horizontal enables scrolling horizontally. In this case, the itemSize should refer to the width of an item.

examples.basic: {{ item }}
examples.html: {{ item }}

sections.label: lazyload-doc
sections.description: Lazy mode is handy to deal with large datasets where instead of loading the entire data, small chunks of data are loaded on demand by invoking onLazyLoad callback everytime scrolling requires a new chunk. To implement lazy loading, enable lazy attribute, initialize your data as a placeholder with a length and finally implement a method callback using onLazyLoad that actually loads a chunk from a datasource. onLazyLoad gets an event object that contains information about the chunk of data to load such as the index and number of items to load. Notice that a new template called loadingItem is also required to display as a placeholder while the new items are being loaded.

examples.basic: {{ item }}
examples.html: {{ item }}

sections.label: loader-doc
sections.description: Busy state is enabled by adding showLoader property which blocks the UI with a modal by default. Alternatively, loader template can be used to customize items e.g. with Skeleton .

{{ item }}

examples.html:
{{ item }}
{{ item }}

sections.label: Programmatic
sections.description: Scrolling to a specific index can be done with the scrollToIndex function.

examples.basic: {{ item }}
examples.html: {{ item }}

sections.label: Scroll Options
sections.description: The properties of scroller component can be used like an object in it.

sections.label: Template
sections.description: Scroller content is customizable by using ng-template . Valid values are content , item , loader and loadericon

import { Component, OnInit } from '@angular/core'; import { SkeletonModule } from 'primeng/skeleton'; import { VirtualScrollerModule } from 'primeng/virtualscroller'; @Component({ template: `
Item: {{ item }}
Index: {{ options.index }}
Count: {{ options.count }}

Even: {{ options.even }}
Odd: {{ options.odd }}
`, standalone: true, imports: [SkeletonModule, VirtualScrollerModule] }) export class ScrollerTemplateDemo implements OnInit { items!: string[]; ngOnInit() { this.items = Array.from({ length: 1000 }).map((_, i) => `Item #${i}`); } }

props.name: dt
props.description: Defines scoped design tokens of the component.

props.name: unstyled
props.description: Indicates whether the component should be rendered without styles.

props.name: pt
props.description: Used to pass attributes to DOM elements inside the component.

props.name: ptOptions
props.description: Used to configure passthrough(pt) options of the component.

props.name: id
props.description: Unique identifier of the element.

props.name: style
props.description: Inline style of the component.

props.name: styleClass
props.description: Style class of the element.

props.name: tabindex
props.description: Index of the element in tabbing order.

props.name: items
props.description: An array of objects to display.

props.name: itemSize
props.description: The height/width of item according to orientation.

props.name: scrollHeight
props.description: Height of the scroll viewport.

props.name: scrollWidth
props.description: Width of the scroll viewport.

props.name: orientation
props.description: The orientation of scrollbar.

props.name: step
props.description: Used to specify how many items to load in each load method in lazy mode.

props.name: delay
props.description: Delay in scroll before new data is loaded.

props.name: resizeDelay
props.description: Delay after window's resize finishes.

props.name: appendOnly
props.description: Used to append each loaded item to top without removing any items from the DOM. Using very large data may cause the browser to crash.

props.name: inline
props.description: Specifies whether the scroller should be displayed inline or not.

props.name: lazy
props.description: Defines if data is loaded and interacted with in lazy manner.

props.name: disabled
props.description: If disabled, the scroller feature is eliminated and the content is displayed directly.

props.name: loaderDisabled
props.description: Used to implement a custom loader instead of using the loader feature in the scroller.

props.name: columns
props.description: Columns to display.

props.name: showSpacer
props.description: Used to implement a custom spacer instead of using the spacer feature in the scroller.

props.name: showLoader
props.description: Defines whether to show loader.

props.name: numToleratedItems
props.description: Determines how many additional elements to add to the DOM outside of the view. According to the scrolls made up and down, extra items are added in a certain algorithm in the form of multiples of this number. Default value is half the number of items shown in the view.

props.name: loading
props.description: Defines whether the data is loaded.

props.name: autoSize
props.description: Defines whether to dynamically change the height or width of scrollable container.

props.name: trackBy
props.description: Function to optimize the dom operations by delegating to ngForTrackBy, default algoritm checks for object identity.

props.name: options
props.description: Defines whether to use the scroller feature. The properties of scroller component can be used like an object in it.

templates.name: loadericon
templates.description: Loader icon template of the component.

emits.name: onLazyLoad
emits.description: Callback to invoke in lazy mode to load new data.

emits.name: onScroll
emits.description: Callback to invoke when scroll position changes.

emits.name: onScrollIndexChange
emits.description: Callback to invoke when scroll position and item's range in view changes.

components.name: scrollpanel
components.title: Angular Scroll Panel Component
components.description: ScrollPanel is a cross browser, lightweight and skinnable alternative to native browser scrollbar.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Scrollbars of the ScrollPanel has a scrollbar role along with the aria-controls attribute that refers to the id of the scrollable content container and the aria-orientation to indicate the orientation of scrolling. Header Keyboard Support Key Function down arrow Scrolls content down when vertical scrolling is available. up arrow Scrolls content up when vertical scrolling is available. left Scrolls content left when horizontal scrolling is available. right Scrolls content right when horizontal scrolling is available.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: ScrollPanel is defined using dimensions for the scrollable viewport.

sections.label: Target Element
sections.description: Setting the target property to parent binds ScrollTop to its parent element that has scrolling content.

components.name: select
components.title: Angular Select Component
components.description: Select is used to choose an item from a collection of options.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Value to describe the component can either be provided with ariaLabelledBy or ariaLabel props. The select element has a combobox role in addition to aria-haspopup and aria-expanded attributes. If the editable option is enabled aria-autocomplete is also added. The relation between the combobox and the popup is created with aria-controls and aria-activedescendant attribute is used to instruct screen reader which option to read during keyboard navigation within the popup list. The popup list has an id that refers to the aria-controls attribute of the combobox element and uses listbox as the role. Each list item has an option role, an id to match the aria-activedescendant of the input element along with aria-label , aria-selected and aria-disabled attributes. If filtering is enabled, filterInputProps can be defined to give aria-* props to the filter input element.

examples.basic: Options

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Select is used as a controlled component with ngModel property along with an options collection. Label and value of an option are defined with the optionLabel and optionValue properties respectively. Note that, when options are simple primitive values such as a string array, no optionLabel and optionValue would be necessary.

examples.basic: <p-select [options]="cities" [(ngModel)]="selectedCity" optionLabel="name" placeholder="Select a City" class="w-full md:w-56" />

sections.label: Checkmark
sections.description: An alternative way to highlight the selected option is displaying a checkmark instead.

examples.basic: <p-select [options]="cities" [(ngModel)]="selectedCity" [checkmark]="true" optionLabel="name" [showClear]="true" placeholder="Select a City" class="w-full md:w-56" />

sections.label: Clear Icon
sections.description: When showClear is enabled, a clear icon is displayed to clear the value.

examples.basic: <p-select [options]="cities" [(ngModel)]="selectedCity" optionLabel="name" placeholder="Select a City" class="w-full md:w-56" [showClear]="true" />

sections.label: customfilter-doc
sections.description: Custom filter can be applied with the filterTemplate .

examples.basic:
{{ selectedOption.name }}
{{ country.name }}
examples.html:
{{ selectedOption.name }}
{{ country.name }}

sections.label: Disabled
sections.description: When disabled is present, the element cannot be edited and focused.

examples.basic: <p-select [options]="cities" [(ngModel)]="selectedCity" placeholder="Select a City" optionLabel="name" [disabled]="true" class="w-full md:w-56" />

sections.label: Editable
sections.description: When editable is present, the input can also be entered with typing.

examples.basic: <p-select [options]="cities" [(ngModel)]="selectedCity" placeholder="Select a City" [editable]="true" optionLabel="name" class="w-full md:w-56" />

sections.label: Filled
sections.description: Specify the variant property as filled to display the component with a higher visual emphasis than the default outlined style.

examples.basic: <p-select [options]="cities" [(ngModel)]="selectedCity" variant="filled" optionLabel="name" placeholder="Select a City" class="w-full md:w-56" />

sections.label: Filter
sections.description: Select provides built-in filtering that is enabled by adding the filter property.

examples.basic:
{{ selectedOption.name }}
{{ country.name }}
examples.html:
{{ selectedOption.name }}
{{ country.name }}

sections.label: Float Label
sections.description: A floating label appears on top of the input field when focused. Visit FloatLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<p-floatlabel class="w-full md:w-56">
    <p-select [(ngModel)]="value1" inputId="over_label" [options]="cities" optionLabel="name" class="w-full" />
    <label for="over_label">Over Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>
<p-floatlabel class="w-full md:w-56" variant="in">
    <p-select [(ngModel)]="value2" inputId="in_label" [options]="cities" optionLabel="name" class="w-full" variant="filled" />
    <label for="in_label">In Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>
<p-floatlabel class="w-full md:w-56" variant="on">
    <p-select [(ngModel)]="value3" inputId="on_label" [options]="cities" optionLabel="name" class="w-full" />
    <label for="on_label">On Label</label>
</p-floatlabel>

sections.label: Fluid
sections.description: The fluid prop makes the component take up the full width of its container when set to true.

examples.basic: <p-select [options]="cities" [(ngModel)]="selectedCity" optionLabel="name" placeholder="Select a City" fluid />

sections.label: Group
sections.description: Options can be grouped when a nested data structures is provided.

examples.basic: {{ group.label }}
examples.html: {{ group.label }}

sections.label: Ifta Label
sections.description: IftaLabel is used to create infield top aligned labels. Visit IftaLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<p-iftalabel class="w-full md:w-56">
    <p-select [(ngModel)]="selectedCity" inputId="dd-city" [options]="cities" optionLabel="name" class="w-full" />
    <label for="dd-city">City</label>
</p-iftalabel>

sections.label: Invalid
sections.description: The invalid state is applied using the invalid property to indicate failed validation, which can be integrated with Angular Forms.

examples.basic:
<p-select [options]="cities" [(ngModel)]="selectedCity1" optionLabel="name" [showClear]="true" [invalid]="value1" placeholder="Select a City" class="w-full md:w-56" />
<p-select [options]="cities" [(ngModel)]="selectedCity2" optionLabel="name" [showClear]="true" [invalid]="value2" placeholder="Select a City" class="w-full md:w-56" variant="filled" />
<p-select [options]="items" [(ngModel)]="selectedItem" placeholder="Select Item" [virtualScroll]="true" [virtualScrollItemSize]="32" [virtualScrollOptions]="options" class="w-full md:w-56" />

sections.label: Loading State
sections.description: Loading state can be used loading property.

examples.basic: <p-select [options]="cities" [(ngModel)]="selectedCity" [loading]="true" optionLabel="name" placeholder="Loading..." class="w-full md:w-56" />

sections.label: reactiveforms-doc
sections.description: Select can also be used with reactive forms. In this case, the formControlName property is used to bind the component to a form control.

examples.basic: @if (isInvalid('city')) { City is required. }
examples.html: @if (isInvalid('city')) { City is required. }

sections.label: Sizes
sections.description: Select provides small and large sizes as alternatives to the base.

examples.basic:
<p-select [(ngModel)]="value1" [options]="cities" optionLabel="name" size="small" placeholder="Small" class="w-full md:w-56" />
<p-select [(ngModel)]="value2" [options]="cities" optionLabel="name" placeholder="Normal" class="w-full md:w-56" />
<p-select [(ngModel)]="value3" [options]="cities" optionLabel="name" size="large" placeholder="Large" class="w-full md:w-56" />

sections.label: Template
sections.description: Both the selected option and the options list can be templated to provide customizated representation. Use selectedItem template to customize the selected label display and the item template to change the content of the options in the select panel. In addition when grouping is enabled, group template is available to customize the option groups. All templates get the option instance as the default local template variable.

examples.basic:
{{ selectedOption.name }}
{{ country.name }}
Available Countries
examples.html:
{{ selectedOption.name }}
{{ country.name }}
Available Countries
examples.typescript:
import { Component, OnInit } from '@angular/core'; import { FormsModule } from '@angular/forms'; import { ButtonModule } from 'primeng/button'; import { SelectModule } from 'primeng/select'; @Component({ template: `
{{ selectedOption.name }}
{{ country.name }}
Available Countries
`, standalone: true, imports: [ButtonModule, SelectModule, FormsModule] }) export class SelectTemplateDemo implements OnInit { countries: any[] | undefined; selectedCountry: string | undefined; ngOnInit() { this.countries = [ { name: 'Australia', code: 'AU' }, { name: 'Brazil', code: 'BR' }, { name: 'China', code: 'CN' }, { name: 'Egypt', code: 'EG' }, { name: 'France', code: 'FR' }, { name: 'Germany', code: 'DE' }, { name: 'India', code: 'IN' }, { name: 'Japan', code: 'JP' }, { name: 'Spain', code: 'ES' }, { name: 'United States', code: 'US' } ]; } }

examples.basic: @if (city.invalid && (city.touched || exampleForm.submitted)) { City is required. }
examples.html: @if (city.invalid && (city.touched || exampleForm.submitted)) { City is required. }

sections.label: Virtual Scroll
sections.description: VirtualScrolling is an efficient way of rendering the options by displaying a small subset of data in the viewport at any time. When dealing with huge number of options, it is suggested to enable VirtualScrolling to avoid performance issues. Usage is simple as setting virtualScroll property to true and defining virtualScrollItemSize to specify the height of an item.

examples.basic: <p-select [options]="items" [(ngModel)]="selectedItem" placeholder="Select Item" [virtualScroll]="true" [virtualScrollItemSize]="32" class="w-full md:w-56" />

props.name: appendTo
props.description: Target element to attach the overlay, valid values are "body" or a local ng-template variable of another element (note: use binding with brackets for template variables, e.g. [appendTo]="mydiv" for a div element having #mydiv as variable name).

components.name: selectbutton
components.title: Angular SelectButton Component
components.description: SelectButton is used to choose single or multiple items from a list using buttons.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader The container element that wraps the buttons has a group role whereas each button element uses button role and aria-pressed is updated depending on selection state. Value to describe an option is automatically set using the ariaLabel property that refers to the label of an option so it is still suggested to define a label even the option display consists of presentational content like icons only.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: SelectButton requires a value to bind and a collection of options.

examples.basic: <p-selectbutton [options]="stateOptions" [(ngModel)]="value" optionLabel="label" optionValue="value" aria-labelledby="basic" />

sections.label: Disabled
sections.description: When disabled is present, the element cannot be edited and focused entirely. Certain options can also be disabled using the optionDisabled property.

examples.basic:
<p-selectbutton [options]="stateOptions" [(ngModel)]="value1" optionLabel="label" optionValue="value" [disabled]="true" />
<p-selectbutton [options]="stateOptions2" [(ngModel)]="value2" optionLabel="label" optionValue="value" optionDisabled="constant" />

sections.label: Fluid
sections.description: The fluid prop makes the component take up the full width of its container when set to true.

examples.basic: <p-selectbutton [options]="stateOptions" [(ngModel)]="value" optionLabel="label" optionValue="value" fluid />

sections.label: Invalid
sections.description: The invalid state is applied using the invalid property to indicate failed validation, which can be integrated with Angular Forms.

examples.basic: <p-selectbutton [options]="stateOptions" [(ngModel)]="value" optionLabel="label" optionValue="value" [invalid]="value === undefined" />

sections.label: Multiple
sections.description: SelectButton allows selecting only one item by default and setting multiple option enables choosing more than one item. In multiple case, model property should be an array.

examples.basic: <p-selectbutton [options]="paymentOptions" [(ngModel)]="value" [multiple]="true" optionLabel="name" optionValue="value" />

sections.label: reactiveforms-doc
sections.description: SelectButton can also be used with reactive forms. In this case, the formControlName property is used to bind the component to a form control.

examples.basic: @if (isInvalid('value')) { Selection is required }
examples.html: @if (isInvalid('value')) { Selection is required }

sections.label: Sizes

components.name: skeleton
components.title: Angular Skeleton Component
components.description: Skeleton is a placeholder to display instead of the actual content.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Skeleton uses aria-hidden as "true" so that it gets ignored by screen readers, any valid attribute is passed to the root element so you may customize it further if required. If multiple skeletons are grouped inside a container, you may use aria-busy on the container element as well to indicate the loading process.

sections.label: Card
